6w_1tYMcBuJPbyRnWD-tAg.text: I've been to the Breakfast Club a few times, and it's always been a really fun treat.The last time I went was for a cheeky before-work breakfast with a good friend. The queues... yes the queues. The one thing that annoys me about TBT is their no-reservation policy... I feel like a bit of a dweeb queueing up first thing in the morning for a Full English.. but nowhere's perfect. Anyways, the queue was not too bad for us and we were quickly seated in the kitsch restaurant.TBT's food is just gorgeous. Big portions, not too wildly priced and super-friendly super-hipster staff that always have a smile on their faces. Their coffee is delicious too, or they know how to make a proper brew if you're so inclined.Despite the prospect of queuing, I'll definitely be back.

Mb3Q2OoArwWcVk9kBE-zlA.text: It wasn't worth it i have lost my time waiting about 45 minutes the beat thing was the Syrup Pancake

AR7hGhOf2OK1FSLvRK-5JQ.text: I really can't understand why this restaurant is so hot. The food is definitely so common and I don't think it is good ! And when I eat it , it is already cool and the eggs is not good and the toast is too hard to eat !also I need wait about 40minutes I will never ever ! Go here again please don't go here just because the good comment, you can't trust these good comment. By the way the pancake is very common ! Not special and not fresh as well!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. I really can't understand why this restaurant is so hot. The food is definitely so common

SadICVdiNImCwKh6HnS-8w.text: Calling for all breakfast lover!! A must to come to this place to try out their breakfast!! There must be some day that you sleep through the day wake up then heading to town and feel like have English/American breakfast and you couldn't find a place that do all day breakfast!! And now this is the place!! But please take note breakfast serve up to 5pm only but there are still good choice of other breakfast like food in the menu.Have been heard a lot about this place and always wanted to come but never find a good timing to come. There are 3 of us including my little nephew. My nephew loving his Hot chocolate with mash mellow in the pac man mug I had Potato with rosemary and Pancake with bacon which really enjoyed it a lot. The place is a big small so you need to find your way t squeeze it through table and seat. Overall we had a lovely breakfast time !!

HrhoziEu6Y7dUddVz1B77A.text: This place was totally overrated. We got up super early and got there right at eight to avoid the lines. Their "cooker" apparently was broken so after waiting in line for 15 minutes we were told it would take two hours. So we went to the British museum and then came back mid morning. We proceeded to wait in line for an hour. When we got our food it was fine but nothing special. It was a good presentation, but the actual food was a huge disappointment. Not worth the wait. Without a line it might be worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Looks incredible. But it was actually not that good. Way too many favors. The chorizo was too strong. Overrated.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

32EFtmCTZedB8Nh4LSTonA.text: Had been over 5 times and love the place and the concept Good food, big portions and every dish I tried was great. Only downside almost anytime of the day has a big qeue .

ppRUrX95Rm-9kUQwoCQi4w.text: Was looking forward to the breakfast club after arriving from New York and the breakfast/ brunch scene is so good. We went to TRADE yesterday in shoreditch was fantastic so I was hoping breakfast club would be as good but to be honest the poached eggs were overdone one sausage for £2.50 arrives over cooked and looking very lonely on a side plate. The breakfast burrito was also poor compared with all the others I have had even whole foods is better. The service is good but sadly the food is not good I would not wait in line here - go to TEADE

_8RwAz5wlUbYUFDyqECELw.text: Huge queue. Ok I'll wait. I have been to the Shoreditch one and I anticipated this.However I didn't anticipate that it was exactly the same with service upon ordering. Yes the staff were friendly but like the Hoxton branch they always no matter what seem to get my order wrong! I don't know why that is. Too laid back? Not experienced? Either way like the East London branch they comped our meal on the house so they get some stars back. Who doesn't like a free meal, I'm not the judges from Masterchef keeping an eye on the clock or details.All in all it's nice. Real nice but nothing too special. I prefer the Hoxton one more though, just for the vibe if anything.

5WZGZhPlFJ5Oa4mczciddw.text: It's all about tourists but London is also about this: eating good, drinking good in fun and cozy ambient.Perfect for brunch until 12am, you'll have to queue but with luck they will give free hot chocolate to whom is waiting! :)I ate the All American menu and Caramel Latte and I was full until night! Perfect to eat a lot and walk around the near streets and shopping in the different stores with discounts and 2nd hand items in a cold Sunday. Not very expensive! +/- 15£ food+drink

oUA2hLJULpSMzYCpqfjeIg.text: Yummy veggie breakfast burrito, amazing fresh fruits and poached eggs. Worth the wait

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Yummy veggie breakfast burrito, amazing fresh fruits and poached eggs

8hITFdsBn-G9nuSYolFcxQ.text: The place to come when you're looking for joyful atmosphere, good music and friendly people. Good vibes and great variety of options for either veggies and meaty people. We didn't need to queue (NOTE: Was Monday morning and some cheeky sunlights were in. Yes, such a perfect plan!)We came for the food so while juices were fresh and good, the winners were:- Avocado & Poached Egg - Kale, Sweet Potato & Feta Taco (Indeed, I have the heart of a gluttony and fancy sharing plates )I believe is a great place for -WHY NOT?- business meetings or WFH days. I feel that environment would take out my most creative ideas. I'll definitely need to come back and try!

KRee9FWqoLa1GUbiMKb-dw.text: It's so easy to find... because there's a LONG line outside! Small place with lots of customers! Food is tasty, but not what I expected. We would like to try the black pudding and it tastes okay. (Maybe just the personal preference...) ordered pouch egg came out scramble... kind of disappointed... didn't ask for re-do because waited for a long time for the food... big potion compares to other small breakfast places... one star off really because of the long line and long waiting...

m-ECe5evLWDSrMQFjvI-0g.text: Great American style breakfast. Among the best in the city. Hour-long lines and very cozy seating though

tj6oaWfvrngLOsmq0BVYbQ.text: Have never made it to The Breakfast Club for Breakfast but dinner is always great!The food is top notch and service always great fun!Don't forget to ask to see the Mayor ;)

2nu_Ugkqnts4hXa9fogxIg.text: So I made the trek across London to grab breakfast at this place, I was a little worried when I saw the line out the front. The staff quickly informed me that it would be about 1 hours wait...  I had a newspaper so I thought heck why not wait as I could smell the food from inside and it smelt amazing. After I finished the paper I had about 20 minutes left to wait long, of all the people that were waiting inline only one couple ended up giving up.   I ended up going for the full Monty and fresh apple juice for breakfast which was quickly served. The bacon was simple amazing and the bread was good bit could have been a bit larger so it could fit the whole egg. I would recommend coming here for breakfast if you have time and just plan for a 45-90 minute wait but the food is worth it

xNQhgYl-eqiYSbfsuPOt3g.text: Since I was missing my good old classic American breakfast, I looked for a place to get my fixing of pancakes and bacon. Breakfast club had it all, and you know it's good because we had to wait 30 minutes on a Tuesday.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. American bfast

3b6xP3deWhzY3pmYeGG0RQ.text: We were looking for a big English breakfast. Waited 45 mins for a seat. Shared tables. The full Monty  £10 came with black pudding. The florentine egg benedict was exquisite with chopped chili and toasted peppers. The all American breakfast came with pancakes and bacon for £10. Also had the kale juice with lime. Went really well with the eggs benedict. About £50 for the great breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The British Breakfast menu.

oVhi-yGPwKPaSRYgdkbV0Q.text: Perfect place for weekday brunch. Came here at 11AM on a Friday, heard about the queues but we didn't have to wait long and there was no queue outside once we were seated. This location is my favourite because it's not far from Bloomsbury campus and fits right into a student budget as well! I ordered the pancakes + bacon with a breakfast smoothie. Both were delicious but I was expecting the smoothie to be a bit larger for the price. Service was excellent and they even gave us cute button pins that read "The Breakfast Club - Soho" I thought that was very nice. Can't wait to come back here again and try more of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with bacon and maple syrup

krmfEq3wtfoM1MDy-KkAbg.text: the food is great and the portions very generous too! I'm very into they toast with avocado and poached eggs and the blood marry too of course ;)the place is very nice and quite cozy, it's better to go off peek hours if you know what I mean .. around 3pm when it is not that busy. the staff is also very nice :D

a7DCLGM1uCGtaHMOCPFqrw.text: Went here 2 weeks ago. Still remember how salty and terrible the chorizo was. I got the Huevos Al Benny and my friend had  the Breakfast Burrito. They were basically the same meal in different formats. Mediocre at best, but then points deducted for giving us high blood pressure years in advance. Seriously, I couldn't eat any more of the chorizo after a few bites. Sodium overload."Oh yeah, and the coffee tasted like burnt, old socks" -- input from my friend who went with me.Cheers!

25q0Vaw76ixyzw6iExi3Eg.text: Great vibe. Tasty food. Enticing drinks.The only problem you might have at this charming little cafe in Soho is finding a place to sit - or maybe trying to decide what to choose from their menu. The atmosphere is cosy and inviting, the waiters friendly and helpful, and you'll feel at least 20% cooler when you walk in.I had a full American Breakfast and everything, from the sausage and bacon to the pancakes and syrup, was excellent. A couple of negative points for the overly-gingery juice but it was hard to feel too annoyed by that small slip.Recommended.

0fWkcdK_zresoDy09Y-omA.text: Great place for breakfast, but as mentioned by another reviewer, if you get there to late, the queues are long. I love it though. The food is always great - good produce and prepared well. They do a good coffee too. A little trick if you work or live nearby in the event of the queues... Get their breakfast box to take away. It's an amazing value full breakfast, and you don't have to wait for ages to get it!

s64fpewRUq9yukAG4imlfw.text: I had an egg on pancakes with ham and cheese. It wasn't very good. The combination of flavors was really off putting. Perhaps something else on the menu would have been better. Tap water was free though and the service was good.

c7034fz9lnm3rVzxsRoRHw.text: It's crowded, it's lively - and it's a fantastic place for a Sunday brunch - as can be seen by the many people standing outside waiting for a table.The breakfasts are filling, delicious and varied, the service is quick and friendly. Overall a really great, friendly and cheerful place to have a tasty breakfast or brunch.

FK-VWOANBWGACeTMMrEmoQ.text: no doubt the best place for a weekend brunch - but get here early because the queues are out the door!

jSI6AH-M-gtQKbE8y8e0tQ.text: I recently decided to hunt out London's best breakfast offerings and the Breakfast Club is definitely a no-nonsense, heart attack inducing faire that has become a firm favourite for our hangover crew. It's a retro style café so I love the interior as much as the food as it has a very welcoming feel to it, where you can just chow down and lament over the night before. The staff seem to have an understanding that you NEED your food swiftly and with minimal fuss, because if you don't get it asap you might just die (or at least something horrible is going to happen inside you due to the cocktails, sambuca shots and er what was the rest that you drank the night before?) They're very fun and friendly. As soon as the food arrives a silence of at least 10 minutes ensues as everyone's thinking what a little lifesaver the BC is. Their food is on the calorific side, so dieters beware, but it's so, so good. Their hearty bacon and sausages are bound to please the carnivorous of the bunch and the doorstep thick toast soaked in butter is heaven. Even better dipped in the boiled eggs that they manage to cook perfectly every time. (Thank God, as a too runny egg might just mean game over for the most queasy hangover victim.)Don't you dare order the Special K!

Z9gD0YmI5sKfe9ZZqxaF4w.text: I had the Reggie the Veggie and the boyfriend had the Full Monty.  My breakfast was definitely on the less greasy side and I sort of regret going for the veggie option as I watched the boyfriend devour his breakfast.  I'm as big of a fan of English Breakfast as any other person who loves grease, baked beans, tomatos, mushrooms, bacon and that whole sort but felt that breakfast could have been both greasier and cheaper.  The fresh squeezed orange juice was refreshing with the meal and we ordered a chai latte to go.Staff were cheerful and service was fast.  The whole cafe gives off a trendy feel to it.  Free wifi is always a plus too!

xCO3pT14YnVsHEhxdDQ0Nw.text: I went their with a friend to have breakfast on a weekday. While portion size is generous I cannot say that I was overwhelmed. Especially when you compare this to other breakfasts, for example The Pavillion in Victoria Park. The noise level is pretty high: Bad acoustics due to the structure of room and loud music made a conversation challenging, and it wasn't even full. I can only imagine the noise level on a weekend. Nonetheless the breakfast was good. I'd recommend their branch in Angel over this one.

vO_spDsS_LGAgmyTcYMJYw.text: This is a cute little place that serves up dynamite sandwiches, and I'm not talking little flimsy things but great big wedge sandwiches. I had a toasted Club which was on a combo of white and brown bread, crammed with filling. It was 'OH SO GOOD!' The smoothie/shake I had was also sublime.This is a great place with a good menu and it certainly isn't just for breakfast.

ZK05qz72nitm1BQiTSGuQw.text: I'll add my two pence to all the positive reviews of this place. Bright, sunny, warm, funky, the Breakfast Club is my idea of a successful cafe. They've got good coffee, tasty smoothies, delicious sandwiches, and all kinds of fill-your-belly-to-the-max ginormous breakfast dishes, as befitting a spot named after the most important meal of the day.However, the best part about this place by far is the suuuuuper nice and friendly people who work there. If you ever find yourself in the situation of eating and using the free wi-fi in a bright orange jumpsuit, you might find yourself chatting with the fun people behind the counter who will then offer to join in your high-tech scavenger hunt adventure game. They might even give out passwords in return for getting serenaded by Beatles songs, which is a true sign of a fantastic and outgoing cafe staff that I'd like to hang out with. Espeecially you with the moustache.I'll happily kick it in the Breakfast Club any day. Good food and good company = 4 solid stars from me!

o4J8Vr0Q29iWfm2a37mn2g.text: A shout out for my favorite local chain breakfast place where you can get good American breakfast/brunch in a casual atmosphere.  This location meets the mark--good vibe, cozy, edgy, fun and good food.  They know how to poach an egg ,they are generous with the food, and everything always tastes good.  Oh and good coffee.  Aloof servers of course, but tha sometimes seems to be TBC's way.  Happiness on the weekends except for the lines....

PJP2NXBgds4SrS_8-ydSoA.text: The queue was down the block but went fast.  The menu includes a lot of meat dishes or soy meats but there are some veggie items as well.  My wrap was very good but a little too oily.  The decor of the place is very fun and the staff is very nice which makes the experience much better.  I want to try the other locations eventually.

ucCE9f9zKUC1WQeHeQYN9w.text: Compact to say the least. Fast service and large portions too. Good food hence the crowds outside, a little over hyped though but still good fun. Go early, just got seated at 0930 with no wait on a Sunday.

wJGinCZxjR_fVEcdjEOeHA.text: I enjoyed it and would definitely return, though probably not in a great hurry. I'd tried to get in once before on a weekday lunchtime and couldn't get into the door, but finally succeeded last weekend. It is pretty cramped and you'd probably be better off heading there early in the morning to make sure you get a seat, but the food was good and pretty quick (we both had the American). Came to about £20 for two with a drink each which wasn't too bad.

TqNtIxUNAIso-Ib8tOtO4g.text: The Breakfast Club is more about being brilliantly and kitsch-tastically nostalgic for the '80s than it is about getting a good hearty breakfast in you. The decor, the ambiance and the 'vibe' (yeah, I hate that saying too) are all spot on; from the comedy blackboard outside spouting breakfast-relevant witticisms to the Happy Meal toys from your childhood and the photos of brat pack flicks on the walls, it's a nice place to discover. Portions are sizable and the menu features all the staple breakfast items you'd hope for; but the food is reasonably greasy and in some cases a little on the bland side. Oh, and if you're not a fan of grimeyness then I'd steer clear. I can imagine clean-freaks would get the urge to don the marigolds and give the whole place a good scrub. It's a tiny little cafe so there aren't that many seats, and it can get freakishly warm and smell a bit like toilets if you sit right in the back. But it's a fun place to visit occasionally, especially when you're in the mood for a good old fry up.

cCAogfA6NKLVcrIBJUCcwA.text: When ever I am going through a day-after-parties sort of an experience, Breakfast Club is were I wish to be. If I only have any energy left, I will drag my self there. The menu full of comforting variations of breakfasts, boosted with fresh smoothies and good coffee is just a life saver.The generous portion sizes will guarantee that this breakfast is the only you thing you need to eat during that day, and most likely covers all the calories per day (or two) as well.And it is hard to explain how the orange yellow world's brightest decoration with some the beach boys tunes on the back ground actually makes the place just cosy and hopeful. But it does.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

zK02hmyU6fWythECeAU-3Q.text: A kitsch hippy take on the American Diner. The service is fine with friendly staff who spend a lot of time apologising for the slow kitchen in the basement. The All American Breakfast is not as good as I could make at home, the Traditional English was very plain - poor cuts of bacon and cheap baked beans! Fine if you are passing by, but don't believe the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

BmGjBXO6f61MAnLibulDbA.text: Went for first time winter 2010. I'm a fan. Satisfying food, great menu of breakfast standards and warm inviting ambience.

K5GIyY-cyZwQlngPEtaozg.text: We came here for our first breakfast in London and had a great time. We both had Reggie the Veggie and enjoyed a full meal that gives you all the energy you need to start your day. Yummy. The place is small, warm and cosy. The service is good and fun.

SoG3s7zMT8sYaH6Zdm8llg.text: A place I always ending up at after weekend including too many pints or if I just want to have a safe choice including a full breakfast of all flavours. Looking for a nice brunch place hidden off on small street in central London  The Breakfast Club. Recommend  londonsvenskar.com/nicol…

S2htpuXZ0roobPuhbxy03g.text: Amazing breakfast! Had to wait about 45 minutes to get in, but was worth it. Great vibe. Great food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

ZMdjYAXyVA92YDGCpcHmCQ.text: We had a nice breakfast at BC SOHO and avoided the long lines by getting there at 8:30am.  I wanted to try a traditional English breakfast -- when in Rome, etc. -- so I had the full monty (Bacon, sausage, black pudding, eggs, home-style fried potatoes, mushrooms, beans, grilled tomato and toasted multigrain bloomer).  But I couldn't bring myself to try the black pudding so I subbed it for avocado.  It was pretty good.  The group also shared the pancakes and berries and they were delicious!  Full disclosure, one of my friends had the eggs benedict and she was not a fan but everything that I ate was good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. pancakes and berries
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. full monty
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. eggs benedict

0NvSVXzBqWLmj3GushELMA.text: I've been to this place several times as friends visiting london have heard good things about brunch here. Generally the savoury food here is better than their sweet- not a fan of their famous pancakes. Good food but not worth the long weekend brunch queues.

0EvStax4dGwXjQz3hs0x6w.text: I thought was pretty good american style food in London. I had the grilled cheese and found it a bit doughy and slightly off tasting from other grilled food. My wife had the veggie burrito which was great. I didn't try the breakfasts but would next time. Unusually large number of tourists vs locals while we were there. Price was average. Had a couple bloody Mary's which were very good. Don't know if I'd wait in line again for 20min with so many other places nearby but would stop if no line.

EFzZ1A0P_6jHHIlyY27riw.text: Not as great as it is hyped up to be. The pulled pork and sauce on my eggs Benedict made it more Tex-mex style.

anQ6EMt8cgZ67B4u9WND_w.text: The waitress was extremely kind and patient with us. We didn't have to wait a long time for the food to be served. Great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. In love with their ginger ale
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Classic English breakfast, was delicious!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Outside

KUKXF65zJtmrHGUiAVx_jw.text: I arrived just one hour after they opened on a drizzly and cold Sunday morning and there was already a line of 12-15 people out the door.  I'm never one to let a line stop me from a delicious brunch and since I was visiting London for work and dining solo I decided to stick it out.  Once inside service was quick and all of the staff help each other which makes everyone's experience better.  I had my eye on the waffles but went for avocado toast and omg - I think there was a whole avocado on my plate. Service was great and super friendly.  Would for sure go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Admired the street art outside while I waited
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Avocado toast and poached egg w/ bacon

NivwNXSTTO_AGRYLAIoaOQ.text: I arrived about 10 minutes prior to opening and there was already a line waiting outside. Though I liked the chorizo hash dish, I wouldn't say it was great and wouldn't actually recommend anyone to get it. It was just fine. It was a very hearty breakfast though and you can definitely fill up with the portions here. Would give this place another try, maybe I just didn't order the right thing. Service was good.

dJiSQbfXlNofVJPJxdpxcw.text: How convenient this breakfast option was being within 5 mins of our hotel. How inconvenient that no matter what time of the morning you turn up, there's a queue minimum wait time of 20-30 mins long. In this circumstance we waited almost over an hour. It didn't seem right to give up halfway, might as well wait for the novelty of it, standing in the freezing cold, the threat of rain upon us anytime.After finally being seated in the "downstairs" area, which is very tightly packed, you were almost rubbing elbows with other patrons. Not a concept I am fond of. We ordered orange juice for drinks. For food, we ordered the half monty (bacon, sausage, eggs, beans, grilled tomato & toasted multigrain bloomer), pancakes & berries with maple syrup & vanilla cream, huevos al benny (poached eggs, chorizo, roasted peppers, avocado, fresh chillies & hollandaise) and porridge served with home-made spiced plum & apple compote with toasted almonds. All our dishes were very delicious and very filling. Slight criticism on the pancakes which were very dry and not enough maple syrup, also the huevos al benny english muffin was thin and almost overwhelmed by the toppings. My partner commented the al benny was nicely spicy but he's had better benedicts elsewhere. I really enjoyed the music they played on this occasion, nice ambiance added to the experience. Almost to help you forget the line waiting. I would recommend this place to people without mentioning the queue to test their conviction. But every once in a while it'd be worth waiting to come here, at least I'm glad we've done it once.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The half monty
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Porridge
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos al benny

gNb9vMjgqcozNsJibprqaA.text: Came here around 9ish and there was already a line out the door, but it wasn't too bad. I got the Full Monty and sub the black pudding for avocado and the beans for more potatoes. The avocado definitely didn't taste right, which is a huge disappointment (I love avocado).My husband got the Pancake and berries. He really enjoyed it.Portion was very big as well.-1 star for:1) the avocado 2) service was a little slow. We were seated first but a couple after us got helped before us. And it took a while to get the check. (They need another waiter or waitress)Overall, food is good. Just go early to avoid the long line.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancake Berries
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Full Monty (Sub Black Pudding for Avocado and beans for more potatoes)

4ku-YH4GlRrZawQiYReDLA.text: Great breakfast or brunch spot. Portions are huge! Service is good and also fast. Beware: The line may often end up  on the outside.

Qgrhd95siqW2t3QsnHjptw.text: this club provide you delicious and healthy breakfast which is give you energy and taste, this is my favorite place in London for Breakfast.

4t73ljW2VI7FhIXmA_yUZA.text: 45-60 mins wait at 9am was worth the wait!! Food was delicious and the service was nice. Portion size was good and pancakes were delicious. Little tight on the space as I guess it can accommodate only 25-30 people at one time, but they try to make adjustments. Same goes for washroom which was a too small for tall people. One good thing was that the host would come out every 15 mins to tell you the updated estimated waiting time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast Tea!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Veggie all American!

jauigBWTbiRyKt-UfXXr_w.text: This place is breakfast heaven for foodies!!Located just off Oxford Street in Soho, this is a must-visit if you are in London! There's always a queue here but we were lucky and only had to wait around 20 minutes for a table...happy days! The decor is cool with a funky 80's vibe. The staff are all really friendly and there's a really relaxed atmosphere in the place, even though there was a crowd of people waiting outside we didn't feel rushed at all!I opted for the pancakes with berries, vanilla cream and maple syrup and they were honestly the best pancakes I've ever had. The portion size was ginormous and I couldn't finish them but I really really wanted to. My brother got the 'All American' which consisted of pancakes with crispy bacon, sausage, eggs, fried potatoes and a side of maple syrup. He was equally happy with his choice and we barely spoke a word to each other for the whole time we were there...always a good sign!I can't recommend this place enough: If in London, go to The Breakfast Club!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Amazing pancakes with maple syrup, vanilla cream and mixed berries!

DKbqbYe2NVRN5Z7AS1gw1A.text: I am a brunch lover. You have no idea. People have these claims about how they love brunch, but obviously they haven't met me.I had this as my first meal of 2015. Yes. New Year's Day I waited in the cold for about 45 minutes to an hour outside for this. I started at about the sushi store down the street and slowly, very slowly worked my way towards the front. The storefront is super cute and yellow. It pops unlike the other locations.I had the eggs benedict and the all American breakfast. I've had better eggs benny, so I'd pass up on this. The sausage that comes with the all American is AMAZING. REALLY GOOD. I still salivate when I think about it. Bacon and potatoes could have been crispier. The pancakes were fluffy and moist! The syrup on it complimented it well.Overall, it was good. But I'm not sure if I would wait for it again. Hmm... Debatable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. All American
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benny

9e1M_TSY5IogmLTg774ZbQ.text: First of all you have to be ready for the long wait. We waited over 1 1/2 hours and it was worth it. The atmosphere is really warm and the staff is engaging. They really make the wait bearable and there is so much to see in the local area that the time goes by very quickly. After reading the reviews I had to have the pancakes and cream with berries. Also I ordered a side of potatoes. To say it was excellent is an understatement. They gave me a carton of real maple syrup to go with it. I was in heaven!Frankly I have no idea what else was ordered at the table ... I may have lifted my head once during the meal. I cannot recommend the Breakfast Club highly enough.

GEoQEqqdDy2NiwyWouQLfA.text: Went there on a Tuesday afternoon, queued for just around 15 minutes for the table of 2. The restaurant is nicely situated at soho district and it's painted in yellow and makes it catchy!Ordered a Full Monty and a Pancake, the pouch eggs at my Full Monty are nicely done, and the scramble egg of my friend is creamy and tasty too! The portion is very large and beware if your stomach cannot take that many food. Definitely a paradise for meat and potato lovers.Was not disappointed for the authentic English breakfast experience! And the staffs were very friendly and care about the food quality. Would probably visit again when I'm coming to London again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino, not bad, but I'd prefer tea or juice more
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Full Monty.

P4xMcSh3okUMZOXpIjTNgQ.text: Have never understood why people rave on about this and why there is always a queue.Food is nothing special. Pricy and not worth the wait.  So many other nicer brunch locations around London.

9eHCy8In-FML3w6nCiFQzw.text: I really wanted to love this place, but I can only say it was ok.  My husband got the pina colada pancakes, which were the seasonal for April.  They were fluffy and pretty tasty.  I got the regular pancakes with berries.  They were kind of flat and the bottom one was burnt, but flipped over so you couldn't tell until you started to eat it.The staff was nice.  Overall, I'm not sure it's really worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. April Special: Pina Colada pancakes

xz1BMhZ0ROPwGT4z-DPkkg.text: Chicken Benedict only after 12pm........ Not a big fan but passable. Big thing a regular very small place. Tight no space to move around. Plus they don't take AMEX.If you are hungry make sure you go a hour before you turn hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Avocado w/ porch eggs
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Benedict only after 12pm........

9wE73GoWy0-mRHfl7pZz7g.text: The absolute best breakfast food I have ever eaten in my life! If I could come here every day, I most definitely would. Their banana bacon French toast is to die for! I would recommend this to locals and tourists alike. I promise it won't disappoint!

USBD_eAVbUUauV3WvmUq_Q.text: So I finally made it to 'The Breakfast Club'! I'd been meaning to pop my head in here for soo long and did so a few weeks ago. I'm a firm member of the 'brunch' club so I thought this would suit me down to ground, which it kinda did and didn't at the same time.I decided to go for a hot chocolate and the American breakfast, although I was eyeing up the Eggs Benedict (but I had to go back to work, and most def would have been starving within an hour or so). At the time I went, it wasn't too busy maybe 10 people max, but it seemed to be too much for the waitress to handle! She had me waiting for almost 15 mins (did I mention that I was on my lunch break), I was a bit miffed, but shrugged it off. Although it had calmed when she took my order, it still had taken her two attempts before my order stuck in her head!! Down to the food, the pancakes were good, very big (smiles) and tasty too. The scrambled eggs were nice too (minus the herb garnish) it wasn't really needed, but the bacon was very fatty and just not really nice. It was cold and didn't look very  edible, still I ate (no wasting here). The hot chocolate brought memories of my uni days when my flatmate used to put marshmallows in for me (great touch), I enjoyed this a lot! So much so, that I finished it before my food arrived!All in all, it's fine for a quick nibble, but I'll still continue my search for the bee knees in brunch-ery (that should be a real word)! ^_^

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

9LRfcjP1Bvm88A75OdaMIg.text: OK.... not bad, not wonderful, just OK.Long wait to get a table, ordered a full English breakfast with no beans and extra mushrooms: right, it came without the beans but same amount of mushrooms than my friends dish...Portions: huge... Nice black pudding, fried potatoes, lovely fried onion... Not well cooked eggs.I liked the decor and the atmosphere, but the table where we sat was far too small to accommodate 2 dishes, 2 coffees and 1 smoothie.Not bad, but simply not worth it after a 15min wait...

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

8ZcYLu9xkfBODDWDrGoVqA.text: Went with high expectations partly due to yelp reviews. I didn't have to line up as I went early. Service was good and staff was friendly. But I didn't think there was anything special about the food or coffee. Ordered the full Monty and the huevos eggs and thought it was just average.

BNVpWE2j6YmsP_fZ4pOURA.text: One thing that I find is lacking in London, is the choice of breakfast and brunch. I mean, sure, there are many places that offer breakfast, but anyone who has spent even a few days in America, can see that the London scene really lacks good breakfast or brunch places.However, the Breakfast Club changes all that. Pancakes, French Toast, eggs, club sandwiches, English Breakfast...you name it. The Breakfast Club is perfect. However, it's not very big, and can get very crowded on weekends, with queues outside. But it's worth it.

qoT1v19JBFQ4p6pkq7-X7A.text: Decent food at the right price, but the line on the weekends is ridiculous. I'd say its worth a try with no wait, but you can do better if the line is around the corner.

WTNm1mA3Br4QKN5xkb6yzg.text: A super cute little 80's themed cafe/restaurant. We tried for 3 days, to come by based off a friend's recommendation, but the long lines kept us away. Finally made it in after waiting outside in the rain for 10 minutes on a Thursday and got a seat.Super cute ambiance and atmosphere - it's small (hence the long lines outside). As for the food - I don't think I'll go back though. It felt as if they were "trying" to do a traditional American breakfast, but just failed. The dishes were pretty bland - small, tough pancakes (not light and fluffy), overcooked bacon and a sausage that was inedible. I had a breakfast smoothie (strawberry-banana-oats-yogurt) and this was the one saving grace. I'm glad I ordered it.However, I will say this. If I was nursing a hangover - and still a bit drunk - this is perfect greasy-fill-you-up-carb food. Also, I'm told the other locations are a bit better... Maybe I'll try them one day.

QprVE9daoPBxk3Jbguou6Q.text: Echoing what everyone else has said, The Breakfast Club is a lovely little brunch spot in the heart of Soho. Most of the tables have seats enough to accommodate groups of four, but my sister and I, our two heaping plates of food, and our milkshakes cramped our table. We ordered one sweet and one savory dish and split them between us: the chorizo hash and the apple cinnamon french toast. Both were delicious, satisfying, and, as I just said, enormous portions. Fun fact: chorizo dipped in maple syrup is DELICIOUS. Our milkshakes (strawberry and vanilla) were good but not as sweet as we're used to (admittedly, as Americans). The prices were reasonable, especially considering the portion sizes. The waitstaff were also tremendously friendly and brought us a pitcher of tapwater right from the start, so we wouldn't have to keep bugging them for refills. Final thought: the only thing that kept me from thinking this place wasn't transplanted from the LES in NY is its lack of bottomless mimosas.

g6nDdSrZ3hwidc6LWu8wrw.text: Love the Breakfast Club. While I've been to the Hoxton one for breakfast, I usually head to Soho in the evening to take advantage of BYOB - oh yes it exists in central London! The food is really good and the atmosphere is relaxed so it's a great place to start the evening before heading out into town.

-Bw4AFf3_sm_DF-stgWRtw.text: Waited an hour to be seated but that was OK and once in the staff was very friendly.  We ordered the All American so we could sample a range of their food.  It came with 2 pancakes, bacon, British pork sausage, pan fried potatos and scrambled eggs.  Frankly, it was no better than any basic diner in the US (like Denny's).  Most of the food was unremarkable and the pancakes were actually pretty bad, dense, tough and chewy (no better than McDonald's ).

atAxON2ApfCsxgilOzewog.text: Absolutely delicious! I came here to get an American breakfast because English breakfast was not worth getting again. My friends and I came here at 10AM and only waited until 10:20AM. This place was notorious for long waits, but it went by very quickly. The ambiance is very cute and hipster (if you know what I mean). The service is wonderful considering how busy they are. It's very small and crowded so that could be a factor to consider.I ordered the eggs benedict with fried potatoes and a coffee with skim milk on the side. my only complaint was the eggs benedict could have been drenched more...My others friends ordered the same dish and berries pancakes, which looked pretty good. I definitely want to come here again and try more breakfast dishes. It was awesome.

51Y6FRwT2cnhAqSTxaY-2w.text: Always good, always consistent. My first point of call when looking for somewhere to show non-Londoners. Sometimes there's a bit of a queue (this branch is quite small) but it's normally worth it. I don't think I've ever waited longer than 20 minutes but that was in the summer..I've also been to Breakfast Club solo before if that's a marker on how much either I like it or how good it is. Staff have always been friendly to me and I've never complained about my food.I've had and heard good things about: Full Monty, Hot Pastrami Sandwich, All American Pancakes, Sausage and Egg Butty, Huevos Al Benny (soooo good) and the best freshly squeezed apple juice I've ever had. It just seems like a solid choice for brunch enthusiasts, maybe not the most adventurous menu but come here for very good, filling food and a good atmosphere.

C34o-jnPxYSkafwyJu3LEg.text: Loved this place. Very veggie friendly, the absolute best veggie sausage I've ever had! Super friendly team members and awesome food to boot. Can't wait to go back!

5h0luKK7oSjjRfwXikQC1g.text: If I'd written this review 2 years ago, I would have rated The Breakfast Club 4 or even 4 1/2 stars but based on my last couple of visits I now can only give it a 3 which is a shame. I fear that the eatery, at least the Soho branch, may have become a victim of its own success thanks to a lot of good word of mouth - which I have provided - and press from reviewers like Time Out and Yelp itself. The food itself is fantastic - full of a wide variety, delicious and extremely filling, even if I have it for breakfast, I can still be full up by late afternoon! Their fry ups, pancakes, smoothies and milkshakes, particularly the Elvis, are simply divine! However what has disappointed me over the last couple of visits is the queuing, seating / lack of and poor service - sometimes resulting in receiving incorrect orders and once my order had to be returned and my friend had practically finished theirs by the time my correct order came out! It was kind of embarrassing as I'd really bigged up the place too so I'm sure my friend thought I was full of rubbish then after such a recommendation!I hope The Breakfast Club improves on the things that I and others have marked it down for and it is ultimately a great place!

vrMekz6bG3r3bmqyFD_6Lw.text: It was alright but i would not wait in cue just to be seated to eat a regular breakfast...

wbgewpzLVat1WTgnAYMnuA.text: I come here so often I should probably consider buying shares. I love everything about this place, I'm even prepared to put up with the long queues and that's saying something! The service is good and fast- once you get in. Most importantly though, the food, oh the food! I usually go for brunch; the portions are huge and the food is great. 9 times out of 10 i'll go for the All American Veggie- Pancakes, eggs, veggie sausage, mushrooms, hashbrowns and maple syrup- yuuuuuum! I most definitely recommend this place, but if you go during peak hours, prepare to queue and share a table!

CGa6O6pKCRNk9NK8Pev_fg.text: As visitors we were looking for a breakfast place which also offered gluten free choices. Several listings on the internet s hared that The Breakfast Club, Soho, had such offerings but not accurate.  We waited in line and we're finally ushered to the back. Very busy restaurant so we were patient waiting for service.  I was hungry for pancakes but was very disappointed as these were thick, doughy, and had no flavor. The bacon was undercooked but that may be a local thing.  My egg was ordered over easy but it was served as hard as a frisbee.  My daughter's potatoes were tasteless with no seasoning.  Her chorizo sausages were tasty.  Overall, this one experience would lead me to not recommend this restaurant for breakfast. L

KdLuZjjCYhvxgN7Z4o1sMg.text: Be early! Fills up very fast, but is definately worth the wait. Large portions, pricey but very tasty. We had the 'Full Monty' and what can I say: Very British indeed! It' been quite an experience for us. Good service, all very nice!

_X5k3oe5A3zzQLiofrv-8g.text: The food in here is really great.  The service is good too.  You might have to wait for a table as they don't take reservations. (if you're american, you're used to this) but once you get inside the (very intimate) eatery, the food shouldn't disappoint.Would definitely go back, I just wouldn't wait outside on cold London morns.

3_futbeCYHWKKox8Y_sjdQ.text: While touring London, we were looking for a good place to eat a British Breakfast. Looking on Yelp, we decided on The Breakfast Club located in SOHO. When we arrived, there were about 18 people in front of us. We waited about 30-45 minutes. We were also a group of 18. We were split up into 2 tables which was fine. As other reviewers suggested, the place is unique. They don't use typical tables and seats at all areas of the restaurant. Most of the group either had the Eggs Benedict, American Breakfast or the Full Monty (British Breakfast). All were wonderful and tasty. Good portion sizes suitable for sharing especially when we wanted to sample other foods later in the day. Suggestions: For kids, order side (eggs, bacon, etc.)Try their juices (apple, orange, virgin mojito). Their juices are made to order.

gp0WWOpTlFF9NGpm1YVG1Q.text: After a morning of careful research on the best breakfast spot in town, I finally narrowed my choice down to 'The Breakfast Club'.  For starters, how could one go wrong with a place that's solely dedicated to making the most important meal of the day?  Upon arrival, I was immediately taken back to the "too cool for school" breakfast/brunch spots in New York and San Francisco.  Although these normally annoy the shit out of me, I was quite pleased to see a place like this in London.  Hip, busy as hell, and nearly impossible to get a seat.  Fearing the worst, we almost turned around and headed back to the always reliable Balans Cafe...however I couldn't stop staring at the eggs benedict and other delicious dishes that were being served.  Within 15 minutes we magically found ourselves at a table, practically rubbing elbows with the people right beside us.The decor of this place leaves a little bit to be desired.  I typically take photos of most places, however from every angle, it just didn't look great.  I decided to skip the photos and focus on the food.  I guess one could say it's cute. Let's just say I prefer modern over hip and kitch.The menu was hands down one of the most complete I've ever seen in London in terms of breakfast.  Spicy chorizo, full American breakfast with maple syrup, streaky (real) bacon, English breafkast, eggs benedict, breakfast burrito, etc.  I honestly felt like I had entered a portal that mysteriously placed me on the other side of the pond.  Being a true yankee that has no qualms with scarfing down a 1000+ calorie meal before noon, I opted for the full American Breakfast:  Two eggs scrambled, streaky bacon, potatoes, pancakes with maple syrup, toast and sausage. The food came out faster than I expected, almost freakishly fast.  I foolishly thought that I'd succeed in smashing every last bite, but I was clearly wrong.  That breakfast made the most of me.  In flavor, I'd give it an A.  It's really really hard to screw up breakfast food and let's face it... it's not world class cuisine  I'd give it an A++ for portion size, food delivery time and service.  I've actually had a tastier breakfast at Balans, but I'll keep coming back to the Breakfast Club to try everything on it's extensive menu until my belly can't handle any more... or at least until I get tired of waiting in line 20 minutes for pancakes that I probably could easily make at home in the comfort of my own kitchen.

bLRdiOjbD4AULrAmuSSuzg.text: It is a lovely hip place to go for breakfast, there are 3 in London all normally have a queue, superb Bloody Mary, it is spicy hot, don't think it's individually made though, enjoy a good breakfast any time of the day. Fairly reasonable prices. It's quite noisy though and can be difficult to hear yourself speak.

udC94ARG2Owxhz8JC93ZQw.text: The Breakfast Club is a great place to go for brunch, but make sure you plan ahead. I'd heard so many great things about it, so I arranged to meet with a group of friends there for brunch but ended up having to eat somewhere else the line was so long! It is definitely not one of those under-wraps restaurants. It's good, and everyone knows it. Don't expect the creme de la creme of swankiness when you walk in. It's a divey, hipster, warm place. Not meant for the faint of heart when they see a sticky spot on the table.Of the 2 times I actually ate there, a wait was necessary. Once was around dinner so it wasn't too bad, but the time I went for brunch (knowing about the lines) we all had to wait about 30 minutes. Turnover isn't fast here, so you'll have to slowly wait for your breakfast. The staff there is always nice, playful, and helpful if you have problems with being indecisive like me. The time I went with a big group of friends, we were all starving. After looking over the extensive menu, we decided to order a bunch of sides in order to get variety. I ordered french toast, eggs, bacon, and potatoes. All for £7! It was incredible. The waiter brought me my plate that was filled to the brim. 4 pieces of french toast, scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, and delicious potatoes. I was in heaven, and so was my wallet. I would come here again and again, but the line is so restricting!

WL4sMbCe3IQnnNfJvoOZmw.text: OK Soho. We need to talk.Stop going to The Breakfast Club.Why do you go here? It's crowded, dirty and falling apart."But the food is good!"Really? The only saving grace of the food here is that the sheer quantity of it beats your stomach into a stupor from which it doesn't recover until well past lunchtime. The last meal I ate here (an eggs Florentine) was substandard to be kind. There was nothing to set it apart, the spinach wasn't properly drained making the muffin soggy, and the muffin was under-toasted. I've had a better Florentine in a Wetherspoon. Same about the breakfast burritos: Overcooked, dry, crumbly chorizo at an eye-watering price. The one saving grace was the tea (mint) , which was made with fresh leaves and pretty nice, I gotta say.   Face it: the food here is frankly average and overpriced."But the atmosphere?"Oh, yes, let's talk about the atmosphere. The 'quaint', 'retro' interior is neither quaint nor retro. It's dirty, under-maintained and rickety. Every single piece of furniture wobbles like a drunkard and feels like it's passed through twelve different schools before winding up in this place.Finally, and this is really the nail in the coffin, you have to queue to get in. Unless you come at particularly unsociable hours, you're looking at around a 20-60 minute wait. Since when was it cool to crowd outside on a rainy day waiting for BACON? Bacon is more important than this, people. There are countless other places in Soho that do a respectable breakfast. The Star Cafe, for example, or even Bruno's.Please. There are better ways to spend your time than queuing outside this place. Do it for all of us.

mLg3tCrU8ar8WHyNEftOig.text: After you survived the queue outside, you can enjoy a good breakfast or brunch. Try to find a good timing so you are not super hungry while doing the line but get hungry once inside ;)I had a full English breakfast and my friend had berry pancakes. Both were really good. Our drinks were very simple (coffee and latte). The service was good. Helpful and efficient.I would go there way more often if there wasn't this huge queue...

y1w5eEDJOuGAL5mE37DeJQ.text: My boyfriend and I visited London for the weekend and because we love Sunday brunches, we chose the Breakfast Club in Soho. This place opens at 9 on Sunday, but we slept in and arrived at 10. We couldn't believe the line outside. A waiter came out and said it would be at least an hour. We decided we would wait. I recommend coming right at 9 on Sunday, because we waited for almost one and a half hours. The staff was great: they came out every 20 minutes to inform us about the waiting time and they handed out smoothie samples.We ended up sharing a table with another couple. We could have said no, but we didn't really mind. We ordered the full Monty (English breakfast) and the American Breakfast. It was a lot for a great price. I can imagine that the American breakfast wouldn't really impress Americans, but it was still a lot and good!We didn't feel rushed at all, even with the long line outside and I can definitely recommend their delicious hot chocolate with marshmallows!

EjugVryfekQb0grrYhT6Bg.text: People are often afraid by the waiting line in front of the restaurant. What's for sure is that you rarely get a table at the Breakfast Club without waiting for a while ...But once you're in, this is one of the best places you can go for a brunch.The smoothies are super good, the main dishes are great (I'm in love with the Breakfast Burrito), and I can testify that the Pancakes & Berries are much better than in a lot of places in NYC that claim to have the best pancakes ever ...If you go to London, you just HAVE to go there !

uBXovUt3uQ1It63sgpdWdA.text: The staff were very short with us coming to closing - and at 10:02pm (they close at 10pm) decided to come over and single out the person that booked the table, indicating that we should blame them for their extremely curt attitude! Never ever seen such bolshy behaviour from venue staff in my life!

6zDnBz0T3m2c5CsOta7JAw.text: Veggie breakfast taste unique and good, veggie sausage and spinach go really well with the pancake, which is so tasty. Come early to avoid the line!!

kXBRBIS498lwtfcehTPocg.text: Had an All-American pancake breakfast. Americano coffee was a bit bitter. Bottom pancake was too soggy. Staff was nice. Location convenient.

iwTZNj5hGeiGpM0p7Uthsg.text: Two hours twenty minutes in the queue for Sunday brunch. I mean I feel ridiculous admitting I was this foolish, but you'd have to serve me the meal of a lifetime to make up for that and they just didn't.

UPvJCKC2mnXLADfAOawtoQ.text: Man, I have no idea what the big fuss is about this place. I think the food was okay, but it seems to be really popular among the Brits! It was recommended by a staff at the W Hotel. Since it's walkable, my brother and I decided to check it out. It is not terrible, but it didn't leave me the feeling of wanting to come back. There is a queue, but not for any good reason... The staff is just okay. I think you come for the unique environment & experience, not really the food.

LRAwnV6qf9AZ3dvXaS8f1g.text: Great place for a cheap byo dinner in soho! A lot of people don't realise but you can bring in your own wine, beer and cider. With no byo charge and tasty burgers and burritos for £10 it's perfect before heading out. Definitely recommend!

-bALe34DLGO31p0QHOfFDQ.text: Poached eggs, avocado and bacon is the holy trinity of breakfast. I highly recommend it.Sadly WiFi does not work

fUrAxvP0o2ywUBesKSwzTw.text: Best brunch place I've been to in London! The food is great, service is fast, and waiters are very friendly. However, the only drawback is how long you have to cue to get seated.

HihvPyiO4Q5Tng1b5YX5qw.text: Flat, chewy pancakesNo drip coffeeGreat mochaGood value, not over pricedCool atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

iQ62GgubVqgWgUaaUKr01Q.text: The queues are crazy - I dont see what all the fuss is about, its ok. It seems to cater toward the American pallet - everything is very sweet and sugary.

KMxeuk7s8h_cVAi8fzbOiQ.text: Epitome of lemming-like hype. Long queues for a dungeon serving third-rate breakfast burritos and cardboard fry-ups.

UKNTKczo9GNCpJCsqGj_9g.text: Waited 40mins, which I was quite quick considering what I've heard from my friends. The food was good. Definitely should visit if you're a breakfast/brunch lover

qoKENCegx2O5CvUH71O9Iw.text: Great spot for breakfast.  I had the avocado toast with poached eggs.  Portion of avocado was extremely generous.  Toast was multigrain and very good.  Cook on the poached egg was perfect.  Also had a taste of the eggs Benedict which was very tasty.  Coffee was OK if not spectacular.  Definitely recommend this place for breakfast.

iuie15XwOXCrH3MOpVkh7A.text: Great food, great service, great atmosphere. There was a long line out the door but we only waited 20-30 minutes and it was well worth it. I had the poached egg avocado toast with bacon and my friend had the huervos Benedict. Both were top notch

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

V09KHNDTJWrBYtwZoHCTQw.text: The English breakfast was sooooo good so much food and I finished the whole plate ! Blood pudding beans potatoes bacon sausage oh my! I had it with some tea and felt like a local. The atmosphere was so chic and there was a bit of a wait. But in SoHo we were entertained. We had no room for anything else. So we were more than satisfied. The English breakfast is popular but people who ordered other dishes such as the pancake and the poached eggs were cleaning their plates . I plan to go back and order something else! Good eats!

VdSkMkPehtSUYNfEtq8N_g.text: My boyfriend and I went there before going to the British museum on a Thursday morning at 10:20, and waited for at least half an hour outside in the cold weather. The waitress told us the back seating area is closed because of something is broken, and kindly offered us hot chocolate in sample cups, which was really nice. However, when we got to the front of the queue we saw from the window that they were quite inefficient with placing people at the tables - a waiter was just standing there texting on his phone doing nothing, and they needed to talk a lot before assigning tables.For the meal we ordered coffee, full Monty and egg Benedict. I have to say that we were VERY disappointed with the food. First of all my full Monty was LUKEWARM - nothing on the plate was fresh out of the kitchen hot, as if it was reheated badly in a microwave. The bacon and toast were over cooked and the beans were too sweet. Nothing else was as good as I expected and the food being cold made it worse. The egg Benedict did not have the classic hollandaise sauce on top of it. The ham was bland, and the English muffin was not soft inside.In conclusion the food at this place is below the average brunch place I've been too, so I really don't understand all the hype against it. I would probably consider it if there is no line and I just need to fill myself with something, but with the 40 minute wait it is definitely NOT worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

VztoGLiJGOjPf1l1VlEk3w.text: In comparison to the clapham one I'd say this is relatively disappointing. It's small which is no problem and the decor is basically the same but sitting down near the speakers was definitely a mistake since all they seemed to play was chart music dating from 2006-2014. Even after we moved it was obnoxiously loud and listening to "yes I like it" while I ate my food put me off it. Shares a playlist with Asda apparently. Service was strange, the service charge policy is loose and I think that makes the waiters behave in maybe a bit of a too intimate way. The waiter pulled up a chair and scooched as if he was eating with us while taking our order and that put us both on edge cos it made it feel like there was a lot of pressure.I see the appeal without a doubt, the food is definitely worth going for and arrives quickly. I had the chicken and waffles while my boyfriend had the Mr. Big Chicken and they were both really good. I just think the general atmosphere including the service puts strain on the quality of the food.

mVKyE1R0Y3OZnviJS6izpw.text: Second time at Breakfast club and although I like it, I don't think it's worth queuing 1h to get in. They do really good pancakes; I also tried the avocado on toast (with extra feta) and they were not cheap on the quantities. Really good coffee as well and nice waiters. The queue though is a real problem. I don't mind queuing a bit for a really good place, but Breakfast Club always have that massive queue (literrally going round the corner of the street) no matter which time of the day it is.They are equally good breakfast place around where you won't need to queue.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

EwuFG5Gwwg7kpXWtg8ibjw.text: Over ratted the salmon wasn't fresh smells really bad and it has black color ! The potatoes really hard !! Waste of time & money I won't recommend it if you're a real foodie there's a lot much better places here in London

kov9pjMSxQ8kwYVNg6BIlA.text: We tried for two days to get in! Our first mistake was on Sunday morning, and the line wrapped around the street. If you're already hungry, it can be hard to justify waiting hours. The next day we tried again and got there promptly when it opened. We still had to wait a while, but not nearly as long. My husband got the full English breakfast and I enjoyed eggs Benedict. All was very good, but a bit salty for my taste. The ambiance inside is warm and lively. Great for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

dIXMIELH375aNw3yQXPJ8w.text: Went here after a recommendation from our hotel restaurant that was no longer serving lunch for the day. We were warned about the queue, but it was well worth the wait. The Pancakes, eggs and bacon were fantastic. The service was also good with good conversation from the server. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

1SEc0Kg7h39FRfoyPYfnEw.text: This place has a pretty really interesting interior design and it feels like you're back in the "old days." The full breakfast plates are filling and not disappointing at all! Looking forward to trying their pancakes later too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

K6CaWCuDFNxJyvsInQVolA.text: This place is awesome, very nice ambiance, great service, extremely friendly waiter and delicious food. We came here around 11 in a Tuesday morning and did not have to wait long, about 30', service was quick and food came quickly. Both the coffee and breakfast plates that my husband and I ordered were great - I gave British black sausage a try but did not like it much.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Nice ambiance
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Coffee
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Coffee

vVcYubWfrei4iEO8N0cImg.text: I always happen to stay at a hotel around the corner so this is my to go breakfast place. There's always a line but totally worth the wait. The staff has always been super friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Cutest little breakfast place.

-pddrWgE5IDOu6NVdYKsLw.text: I wait on line for approx 10 mins in the early morning. The place is a bit crowded. However, the food was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

MO5-FNAlDJAtKGCcw6PwFw.text: Waited about an hour. A little confused about why there is a line since when I was sitting inside there were many empty tables around me...maybe to deliberately create hype? The food was very filling as the portions are quite large and tasted pretty good too except the coffee was not good at all. The staff were all very sweet and pleasant so no issues in service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

RPxtjoGWDgbo2sB2-FaaEQ.text: One of the best meals I've had in terms of English food. I had the Full Monty full English breakfast and my friend ordered the All American. Both were Delicious! Perfectly cooked eggs, fluffy pancakes - who says English food is bland?I have to mention that the music choices were also wonderful. The atmosphere was fun and exciting. The entire experience was really banging!HOWEVER, I have to be honest and fair. I took off one star because the wait was LONG and I wasn't prepared for it. I know. I know. That's really my fault. The food makes the wait worth it but just be warned that you will need a good 2 to 3 hours of time from getting to the restaurant to walking out the door.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The All American!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The Full Monty!

HwQRWjR3vJ2r2yx9-7DIag.text: I went to The Breakfast Club for breakfast with my friend yesterday. He arrived at 9:45 and I got there at 10:15 and we waited for another forty minutes! We expected a line and we sure got one. We finally got in and we received great service. I ordered chicken and waffles and he ordered the All American breakfast. My chicken and waffles were good! The chicken had a lot of flavor and the waffle had rosemary in it which was okay but I wish it came without it so it had more of a sweet flavor. The waffle also came with chili butter which was great and sweet syrup. The syrup wasn't as good as I wished it was, but it served its purpose! All in all it was a good meal and the venue was also really cool!

3XFGbsdGkY-20W0IRxcj4Q.text: I really enjoyed this place! It was busy, with a long line outside, but definitely worth the wait.The staff was friendly, the food and coffee was tasty, with lots of options. I definitely recommend going there for breakfast!

sN8Eh-W5m1ylx6_k2_ageg.text: this place its perfect for a brunch or breakfast. Highly recommend! Such friendly service, some of the best breakfast I've had. There's a plenty of options to choose from and for indecisive people.

OM7k8eAr65OQbwso_8PKcg.text: Just perfect!!!!! As long as u don't mind to wait a queue for 1-2hours :) but the food was amazing I really loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. We were waiting for such a long time tho.. Absolutely loved it and so worth it to wait

2_qAFXBN4O8ddcIjvI1_4g.text: I waited in a 30 min queue outside in the rain for their brunch. While I waited, I peaked through the window and had plenty of time to decide from all the yummy dishes I saw on everyone's table. I opted for the pancakes with berries because of it's presentation (and photo op) my friend got the eggs florentine. The pancakes were not only aesthetically pleasing but they were darn good! The eggs were okay. Overall, I am not sure it's worth the wait. I had an issue with the seating arrangement; you're seated in a very small space, which made for a stuffy environment.  Good food, but slightly uncomfortable atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

GLWvZkkRMn-9sBjiIXWVDw.text: Can you choose a place to eat just based on the name? You sure can! (Sometimes, it works out!)We walked inside and it totally reminded me of our quirky diners at home. Happy 80s and 90s music played ranging from hip-hop to top 40. Our waiter (on wheeled shoes!) was awesome (more on him later.) Let's talk about the breakfast:Reggie Veggie: Two eggs any way you like (poached por moi), potatoes, mushrooms,  roasted tomato, bread, veggie sausage--and the curious beans. The veggie sausage was weird; kind of like a doughy fried stick. Not my favorite thing, but I did like everything else. Well, almost. Beans. Beans, guys? Van De Kamp beans for breakfast? I know that it's a traditional breakfast item here..on the bright side, my passing on them just means more for everybody else :)I can't remember the name of what my guy ordered, but I have a pic of it: eggs, sausages, mushrooms, bread, and peppers PLUS huge delicious chunks of feta. That was some darn good feta. Once we finished, we walked outside and saw that the queue was down the block. Wow, we made it just in time. Oh, the waiter. Imagine it's approximately 14 hours later, around 1am. You're walking to your ridiculously late meal at the Duck and Waffle and see a guy gliding down the street. It's our waiter from Breakfast Club and I swear, as we passed each other, we all did the, 'How do I know them?' I mean in a city with over 8 million people, of course we would run into the same person we just met that day in Soho in the Financial district.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. How you feel at Breakfast Club :)
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Don't know the name, but the feta was great!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Reggie Veggie: eggs, potatoes, roasted tomato, bread, veggie sausage and beans

ZMxLVSDyyI5_kFyeg675xw.text: So, my friend and I are HUGE fans of the Islington branch and try to go there every chance we get. So, while on south bank, we decide to hunt this one up. So we get geared up, I'm a-craving the Breakfast Club Club wrap (OMG....yummmm), we set off in pursuit of our quarry, weaving through the streets like zombies being taunted with brains...to find it closed. It was only 8 pm. It closes at 6 pm....SIX??? What, I repeat, WHAT closes at SIX in SOHO on a Thursday? Apparently, this place.Giant Fail.

dzplohxf9yrN8KH-jUnBcA.text: I arrived at the Breakfast Club with a huge craving for American-style pancakes and got exactly what I needed, not to be too disappointed. As such, I had the All American breakfast, which came complete with eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns (which are really home fries) and of course, pancakes with maple syrup. The pancakes hit the spot, but I was hoping they'd be fluffier. And the bacon was not as greasy and delicious as it should've been (considering it's an American plate!). All in all though, it was a great meal, huge portion and delicious. Contrary to other comments about the service, I thought it was actually not bad considering how busy it was. The queue is long (for us, about 45 min, table of 6), but that was expected.

Q1oMSYskPuKMFxAUkhHrKQ.text: Maybe it's because I sat outside to eat that I didn't get caught up in this place as it appears everyone else has.  Looking at the facts of service and food this place was good, but not amazing.The service whilst incredibly friendly, was a little slow and a little erratic.  The OJ was freshly squeezed, the coffee good.  But the full [English] breakfast (Eggs, 2 back bacon, 1 sausage, portobello mushroom, tomato, beans, toast and hash brown) whilst fairly priced, was just "ok".  And frankly when you got Breakfast in ya name, you should be serving up a breakfast better than ok.If I were a school master and the Breakfast Club my pupil their report card would inevitably carry those immortal words; better, could and do.

G41z1kB4ayHNz3D3GvROOA.text: If you dont die from hunger,as there are long longgggg qs u will enjoy probably the best pancakes ever!!!i highly recommend it if you are patient!;)

lgeAOydKH3SQcyQFdD28mw.text: My friend took me here to get breakfast which really was brunch.  We were in the area on Sunday and I noticed the line but we went in on Monday and there was about a 5 minute wait for a table.  Apparently the weekends get super packed.  I got the Mango Go smoothie and it was delish!  As far as the food, I ordered the American Breakfast which came with pancakes, bacon, sausage and eggs.  The eggs were good, the bacon was good, the sausage was gross (but that could just be me not liking it not that it was necessarily bad) but the most disappointing thing was the pancakes.  I live in Paris so pancakes are not something we get every day here and I thought I'd get a treat and order pancakes.  They were cold!! So disappointing.  I was going to get the eggs Benedict and i really wish i had. The ambiance is nice, cute, cozy place and the waitresses were nice.  Since it wasn't too busy we didn't have to wait too long for food but of course it felt like forever because we were so hungry.  Really the loss in rating is due to the cold disappointing pancakes!

HOe_9s9azI4NvY5MAVrKVA.text: Aug 20094 stars?? No way. It wasn't that great, but maybe all of the hip stuff on the walls and the name put my expectations too high.Went there on a random Tuesday for lunch and was promptly seated. I had the All American breakfast and my breakfast-mate had The Full Monty. Food was eh, just okay. I've had much better in London pubs and ghetto diners in the States. My bacon was just like the bacon in any pub breakfast or Tesco, the sausage was okay and the eggs fine. But, it was the small things that made me not enjoy my breakfast.-the pancakes were NOT great. I like them light and fluffy, but these turned into a doughy blob once you start chewing on them - not a nice feeling in your mouth.-I had a piece of toast from the Full Monty and it wasn't even toast. Just soft white bread with some light press/grill marks. Also, the tomato seemed to be thrown on the grill for like 8 seconds b/c it was still like a regular raw tomato with some sear marks on it..wtheck?-food took about 30 minutes to arrive, which was strange as the place was about only slightly more than half full. But, didn't mind too muchMaybe I'm being too picky, but these are small things that don't need to happen.On the bright side, the coffee was good, juices looked great and the place is cute. It wasn't bad enough for me to not give it a second shot, but it's definitely not 4 stars.

NUtKWqe1tRG5miUS3QOrvA.text: The food and atmosphere were three stars, but the internet password was Emilio Estevez, which is eleventy billion stars. 4-stars it is. We've only met once, but it changed my life forever.

NaSBsFRFbgB1p0cXNS379g.text: I thought TBC was a cute establishment. Nice atmosphere for a place dedicated to breakfast! Food was just okay. And it could happen to anyone... but on the very occasion that I thought I should try Marmite on toast for the first time: the toast served up was moldy. Better luck next time for me. I'd go back and just have a fresh squeezed juice. ;)

UBD9QY3mM_h-RinnUrHH8g.text: A friend took us here when we were in town. We had to wait for a bit, but I think everyone had to wait for a bit. The service (in comparison to the US service I have experience with) could have been more attentive, but I understand that they were probably understaffed and it was packed. I thought the food looked and tasted great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

CNYzCruCfxOE6UgkOb7IoQ.text: 'The prognosis isn't good, I'm afraid it's... it's a sugar coma' Gasp'Oh no Doctor, do you think she'll ever recover?' 'Droopy eyes, serial yawning, zero productivity... it's terminal tiredness.' Seriously people, I think I was roofied at The Breakfast Club Soho. Sarah S. and I destroyed two plates of pancakes at lunchtime and while I felt fine on the walk back, I literally am descending into a sugar coma right now. Alert for all customers: they put something in the maple syrup - massive quantities of sugar. Waitresses seemed a bit sluggish too, maybe it's a conspiracy! Was unhappy to be seated right on top of a fire exit, but at least I'd be out quick if the chef fell asleep over the hotplate.

Crkns3rGTfL7KJxGPpkMeA.text: What a lovely place to spend a morning - sipping smoothies and chatting with friends.The fantastic thing about this place is that they just don't rush you, it does make having a quick snack here difficult but it also means that if you want to sit and enjoy their free wifi - you can do that all morning.Their smoothies are fantastic and really a must!

SJJ900Rv2FQ75QcY46565Q.text: Meh, it was just all right.I don't really see what all the fuss is about.  Perhaps I was in too bitchy a frame of mind to care about the hip kitschiness all over the walls and the eclectic furniture.  The food itself was good but nothing to write home about.  My pancakes were average, but they paled in comparison to a fluffy silver dollar stack at any American IHOP and the vanilla Greek yogurt accompanying them, while tasty, didn't quite make sense to me; I'm glad I asked for it on the side.  Robert D's greasy fry up was, well, a greasy fry up.To sum it up: friendly service, reasonable prices, perfectly adequate foodOur take-away cookie was also simply average.  Eagerly consumed, but average.Would I go out of my way to go back?  No.  Will I return because I live nearby? Probably.

VsxnKnjeJvPQg5Lz9WzHSw.text: BEWARE! NO ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES. i had an early and long morning and was looking forward to a mary only to be disappinted upon seeing the drinks menu. so i settled for a few smoothies and to my surprise they gave me the boost i needed. its a whole lot smaller than the hoxton branch and the wait staff (i hate to say it!) is dull compared to the kids out east. still great food though and cozy/cute decor.

6bFYD0zIJnozEMMh33Ioag.text: Great place !Everything is delicious, special mark for the big plates and the milk shake expresso !

tgP_mUIsvP9MdFwTdlSUzw.text: I came here after an audition in Soho last week as after commercial castings I always feel like I don't have a soul left so I come to eat it back in Burger, fries and milkshakes!!! The Burger was MASSIVE and amazingy tasty!!! The milshake was terrible though!!! I mean if I wanted a pint of milk in a glass I'd buy some from a carton for 50p...not have it in a glass for £3.90...thats how little ice cream was involved!!!!

8lgFHckbKG2Bqq5d0VqvHQ.text: Ok, i had high expectations about this place and as far as decor and ambience go it hit the mark.It was a busy and bustling place, which is reassuring when youre going somewhere for the first time.The food how ever was just average, seriously nothing really to shout about. the funny thing was i had a copy of Timeout London on my table which had a frontage about their feature article 'best breakfasts in london' and the waitress asked "are we in there" i said "i was hoping so, but no".To be honest i would rather try to find new places to have breakfast in soho than return here in any great  urgency.

4Vb7ze1I34OCbJ93msyJkg.text: I think this place is nice, the eggs royale are really tasty. Also from the brunch menu you should try the Greek yoghurt and the Pancakes with sausages and mushrooms. The service is not so fast, but you will enjoy your food.

3JoeiVycQJ6SboWDIvgqqQ.text: I first went here a couple of years ago on a visit to London. Since moving permanently to the big smoke it's become one of my most regular haunts not to mention winning the hearts of everyone I've ever taken there, meat eater and veggie alike. My personal fave food-wise is the 'All American' - sausage, eggs, bacon, mushrooms, pancakes and maple syrup.I've tried tons of other breakfast/brunch joints, some have been good with great food or a really nice environment but none have had the same great mix of relaxed shabby chic atmosphere, tasty salads or great greasy food {depending on what the doctor requires that day!} and amazing not to mention funnily named smoothies that are worth the trip alone! ('Blue Monday' or 'Mango A-Go-Go' anyone?).
