The Breakfast Club is the perfect place for the weekend hangover cure, a catch up with friends or a very informal work meeting (During the week their big table at the front is often taken over by the local media crowd for their informal brunch brainstorms).The only downside is that it's small... that's part of the charm too but you might not always get in. Big groups (4+) might have a bit of a problem if the table at the front is taken but otherwise it's perfect. It's worth any wait though!

0i2XephGyFUPusiPKkfmpA.text: Having seen the reviews, my family and I were looking forward to a great breakfast before a day adventuring in the city.  We waited roughly 30 minutes to be seated which was to be expected. We were lead to our seats and left to with our menus.   Five to ten minutes later we were offered the opportunity to order.  I was disappointed we had no drink order prior.  Approximately 15 minutes after that our meals arrived and we still had no drinks.  A second wait person offered to re-take the order.   The food itself was fine, not worthy of remark save the poor service.  Used the rest rooms before leaving - no soap.  Means no soap for me and of course no soap for the staff preparing or serving the food...ugh.  I recommend not eating here.

OpBu9a4ikT6MoXYIinK4tg.text: came for brunch friends in tow, third in queue and sat in 15min. had my pancakes & sausage, ate Amanda's streaky bacon, some of Pete's full monty and a latte in a huge cup. i eat like a fatty but swear am not (yet). epic portions, each under a tenner. a perfect fry-up if you ask.

Watk0F_VPc8NwvUybalp4Q.text: The buttermilk fried fish sandwich is WHERE IT'S AT. It's like they took the absolute best version of a chicken sandwich and swapped out the insides. You'd think it would be totally gross to mix ketchup, mustard, cheese, and tartar sauce on a fish sandwich, but you would be deliciously incorrect my friend.The ambiance and soundtrack are on point once you realize it's a literal homage to John Hughes, but I do wish they had a more extensive beer selection; Camden Lager isn't exactly the tastiest local brew available.

uaRqL_DElPSc6AnXDML44A.text: Great service and excellent food. Wouldn't change a thing. Yes there is a long line usually-- it's a small dining room and a popular breakfast spot. If you want great food in a big city you'll wait, or simply don't-- but don't punish the restaurant for being popular!The pancakes are excellent, more like dessert as are all pancakes. The Full Monty was delicious, as was the Avocado on Toast, which is more like a well-seasoned guacamole-- get a second egg if you have a large appetite. Finally, all their juices are excellent.

qICmGxMq2lpv9uh5pqOh3A.text: Small place but we went at 9 in the morning today and we only had a 10 minute wait. I ordered the full monty and it was plenty of food and absolutely delicious. Couldn't resist two flat whites and also shared a green smoothie that tasted amazing. My wife had the all american veggie and she liked it a lot. Staff is very friendly, place has a nice feel to it, and the prices are very reasonable. I would definitely go back

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Flat white
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Full monty

XNyPB-PZ552XHnuTBNqgpA.text: Avoid this place. The line was way too long and the food was mediocre. The presentation of the food looks good but quality doesn't measure up. I got the breakfast burrito and felt nauseous the rest of the day.

hOo03XtRutOfC_YIAKdWMg.text: So, I am all about the pancakes, but having had their pancakes twice now, there is really nothing to rave about. I am starting to believe their long queues are just a result of a lot of hype. The portion sizes are big. However, the berries aren't very fresh and the pancakes were not served hot but slightly soggy. The milkshakes are OK. Nothing was terrible, but nothing was particularly great either. There are definitely much nicer brunch places in London with better atmosphere and prices.

mRAXWMtlcPeP4rfU1-48SA.text: Everybody's favourite breakfast place. I thought it was a typical "english" breakfast place but it definitely lives up its name! Is more than that. You can actually taste a variety of breakfast depending on your mood of the day.The service was good. Love the maple syrups.Food wise.. too many choices! And unfortunately everything taste as good! I dont eat pork but the vege version of full monty was soooooooo goood! If you are a vegetarian worth the try. The vege sausages is so juicy and fluffy that it taste like real meat.I have yet to try everything on the menu but Very Berry pancakes and cinnamon apple french toast are my top favourites! I cant help myself each time i walk in the breakfast club not to order them!The only downside is that you have to wait at least 1 hour in the queue to get in! Ridiculous right? But wait.. they do take care of you while you wait. I had wonderful hot choco with marsmallow the other day. I love being taken care!Always bring friends with you because good things are meant to be shared!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Vege version full monty, very berry pancakes, egg benedicts and cinnamon apple french toast

ddB0GsAHhXqqz-mH4_b1CQ.text: Came here for breakfast at 8:45am. Waited for 15 mins to get in. Service was a little slow. But my son loved the food so much that he made me write this review :)  We had The Full Monty which is similar to classic English breakfast. My son found the baked beans delicious! The hot chocolate had lots of tiny pink and white marshmallows on top. So cute. We will highly recommend this restaurant to anyone around the neighborhood.

Co2JGxLVW0lFWa9G4GLFww.text: What a great experience.  We loved this place.  Wonderful full English breakfast, and everything else was great as well.  Staff was friendly, and the service was great.  We will go back on our next trip to England.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Aaron Presley came all the way from Memphis for this.

VgrCPTV8f-tg0D6vt_9Ghg.text: Great food, great service, amazing atmosphere! If you're looking for a cafe for a hearty breakfast, this is it! My party got the English breakfast and the posh sausage sandwich and both were amazing. I will absolutely come back for breakfast next time I'm in London.

A-Vv4OTrK1bpgrZ_UzBtgQ.text: Literally the very best traditional breakfast that we have had anywhere in the world... What it is: friendly, busy, bustling, small, cramped, 45 minute wait and a bit crazy all to add to the ambience. What it is not: chic, nouveau, fancy or pretentious! Great food is what you get! Oh did I mention the best sausage anywhere!

S-ovbW7n7g5QLnVqPlt_mw.text: Came here while vacationing in London. I've never been a fan of breakfast however, after coming here, my opinion on the idea of breakfast has been positively altered! I got the All American, which consisted of 2 pancakes with maple syrup, 2 eggs, bacon, a sausage, and homefries. A lot of food for sure haha! Also got some bread on the side to go with my poached eggs.The consistency of the pabcakes was peeerrrrrfeeecct! And the homefries weren't overly greasy which is always a good thing. Im usually not a fan of bacon, but they cooked it just right here, not too crispy, and bot too chewy...yuk! It's a little tight in terma of space, but the decor is really cute, and they've got some vintage looking furniture. Staff was friendly, and service was very quick!If I ever come back to London, I will most definitely stop by the breakfast club at least once. And for those of you travelling to London, please, treat yourself to a magnificent breakfast here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom and swiss burger
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Super green salad

qNkNllrReSHl2jYFNwx7VA.text: Americanized breakfasts (with an English twist) right in the heart of London to appease your inner Ameriphile. The dishes still were similar to full English breakfast. You would never see baked beans on a standard American breakfast. The juices are made fresh which I was pleased to learn. The scene: a line outside trailing into the alleyway. I'd never seen a line like this before out here. The wait was reminiscent of any trendy brunch spots back home. Quite cozy inside, a bit too cozy for us than we would have liked since we were seated at a 4-seater with another couple we did not know. Slightly awkward. Servers were very friendly, 90s music blasting (Ace of Base, Sisqo the Thong Song - which I probably hadn't heard since the 90s) and service was quick and orders were turned around fast. I was there on a Saturday so perhaps the wait is better on a weekday.

bQhJ0bJUtNoxlUjz7141Nw.text: A friend and I had Reggie the Veggie and Pancakes and Berries to share as we wanted to try both and had shopping ahead of us so didn't want one each. Perfect amount.We waited nearly 1 hour on a Saturday (after getting here at 10). We were politely asked by the waitress if we didn't mind sharing a 4 person table with another pair (a large table so surprisingly not awkward). We didn't have to wait long for the food, but to be honest it was nothing special. The Reggie the Veggie was average as the pancakes. Definitely wouldn't wait the hour again. Understand the hype though now.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Decor
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The food
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

aUoEJzwbh-MwWc5epXMoKQ.text: I queued up around 5pm today and only waited 10 mins. I looked at the menu and was confused as it says brunch served till 5pm. I enquired and the waiter told me to ignore that. Good job because I was starving! I was seated next to the wall of customers comments\drawings which made interesting reading. I like the cosy feeling of this place. I ordered tea and pancakes with Ham, cheddar,fried egg and maple syrup. It was nicely staked and I enjoyed it. I should have asked for more syrup - it tastes sooo good! I will be returning to try a sweet dish.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

ZqoIl4I1-mhXOVxLV4AknQ.text: An amazing place, in an amazing location, with amazing food, and even more amazing service.Everything here was truly fantastic. My GF and I were on holiday in England (from the US) and were blown away by how fast the service was here, how attentive the server was, and how delicious the food was. I got The Full Monty with an americano to drink, and it was da bomb. My GF got the sausage butty with egg and an espresso, and she loved it as well.To be honest, we went basically as soon as it opened on a Saturday morning at like 8 am, I didn't know that a queue often forms quickly, but I had no such experience. We walked right in and had a great time. I didn't even know that people complained about that until prepping this review but, again, my experience was nothing but flawless. Would highly recommend to anyone because it was reasonably priced and delicious!

5doiTwGiM6XXNk5Srko7Cw.text: The food is always of consistent standard across the branches (although the Shoreditch branch will always be my favourite!) which is rare in London. The portions are a fair size and I'm never hungry after a plate. Great pancakes, even better fry-ups!Waiters are friendly and attentive although like many other London restaurants, we find ourselves constantly asking for water. Otherwise, nothing to complain of. The one thing I hate is the constant queues that never seem to go away. Terribly frustrating to have to wait in the cold. Perhaps some sort of system similar to Pizza East could be introduced?

OnaNJ5cS3S7AnOsZ3_tM8w.text: Great little spot.  With the wait even on a chilly Thursday morning at 10am.  Pancake week lemon Merangue special was a huge hit with the kids.

8P6YFAYmL4QOloVFv4DhBA.text: What are people talking about??? The food here was terrible! The first time we came here, the line was really loooong - stretched outside for about a block - which got us excited that the food must be great. However, we were so hungry we couldn't wait, but decided we must return on another day to try the food here.On return, it was much later in the afternoon and there's was no line. We were seated immediately and that's were the excitement died. The hygiene here was clearly lacking - same table cloth was used to wipe several tables and just placed on a railing when not in use, the waiter who cleaned the tables used the same unwashed hands to get a pen, take our order, bring our drinks, straws, and napkins all while cleaning other tables with the same cloth in between. Then came the food, the much heard of, highly reviewed Full Monty ...meh, it should be called Full Nonsense. Everything was bland and tasteless ...the eggs, bacon, sausage, mushrooms, potatoes, and even the bread ...how did they mess that up?!? Anyhoo, we were severely disappointed and pissed. Never coming back here!

slKeML-CDGiBDioQfb4GPQ.text: First thing's first - THEY NEED TO TAKE BOOKINGS!!! I really find that waiting in a line makes you feel like you're at a theme park, not waiting to enter a restaurant... or what you can basically call a glorified cafe!The novelty of this place still stuns me as I really wasn't impressed with my time here and still don't understand why you would want to wait in a queue like that for something so average and overpriced.It's all a bit too wannabe trendy, with their decor and "cool" staff, and especially the food that isn't even that great! By the time you've queued up for nearly an hour, you'll be grateful to be served up anything!The food is nice but definitely not worth the wait or the price! Sorry Breakfast Club, but you don't have my vote!

MQcGhmfQ320uwE0PJoOtyg.text: Great food crippled by inefficient management. The long lines here are a lie. Their queuing system is completely ineffective leading to long waits that could be erased with a more thoughtful process. They don't ask people in line for party size, so they seat the first group at random only to realize that the next group would have been better suited to that table. The group behind waits for half an hour for another table to come available just because they didn't allocate seats right. Turning over tables takes forever. The same person is taking orders, busing tables, seating people, processing payments, and serving. All things that could be done in parallel.  with more appropriate staffing. I don't mind a wait, but I hate when people waste my time due to poor management. Get it together! But maybe that's just the american capitalist in me that can't wait patiently. oh well

ZpDGjLXqJI7D1XfDd3VsZg.text: Not worth even sitting down. I had the vegan pancakes and they were very dry. Some of my family had the regular pancakes and they were also dry. The pancakes are still dry when you try to put a lot of syrup on them. My dad had a chai latte and he said it was bad like how can you mess that up? If you see a line waiting you might think that is a good sign, it is not. The place is just very small.

Er4_k8dGOk3yNtg6xArFbA.text: AMAZING place!!!! The pancakes are amazing & the staff is super friendly! It's a very popular place so be prepared to wait but it's definitely worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Waffles with peanut butter, maple syrup, & Greek yogurt! So good!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

1KZxEdRaJ2daxVGE3vamzw.text: Seriously overhyped. Smoothie was just average. Full Monty breakfast was bland and below average.

l715X5z5uz-aUcCq94HhAw.text: Was very underwhelmed by my breakfast. I believe I first ordered pancakes but they were dry and cold. Returned the order and they happily gave me the chicken and waffles, which was pretty good. Thought the food would be much better but the service and vibe knocks this review up a star. Was impressed by the friendly servers and hosts. The music was amazing. I enjoyed dining there.

qvJYK06CSZlZIdSmpqxI6g.text: I've got to say, the breakfast club is a favourite of mine and this was the first time I've been to this location and it was great! As expected there was a bit of a line but they came out and gave you an estimated time when you'd most likely be served which for 2 of us was about 20mins (it was really about 10mins)It's a small venue but does the job. There are numerous locations all over London and have the same menu with all the classics and more of an American breakfast feel to the place. I had the Elvis shake which is always a winner if you like peanut butter and banana. The All American breakfast is my go to choice even though they have lots of other options. The All American is eggs (done how you want) sausage, potatoes, bacon on top of pancakes with an ample amount of maple syrup!  always hits the spot. It's a cool atmosphere and you should definitely check it out. The one downside is it's pretty pricey...my breakfast with a tip was about £18 but it is good food! Enjoy

S_ZZBD6owWPWfZSE50Nz4A.text: Amazing breakfast food that is worth the wait!We left our hostel a little early just because we knew the lines to get in are long, especially on a Sunday. We started a few shops down just before the Thai restaurant and it took us an hour and a half to get in! But the wait was so worth it!!I got The Full Monty (£10.90) and tried the English Breakfast Tea (£2.20) for the first time. The Full Monty came with a nice juicy sausage that's easy to cut through, poached eggs (though you can get them scrambled or whatever else you'd like), fried tomato, beans, black pudding (which I later found out to be blood pudding), toast, and my favorite mini potato wedges while the tea came with milk.I'm not a fan of black tea so the milk made the English Breakfast Tea bearable. To each their own?The Full Monty was amazing and exceeded my expectations. The poached eggs were amazing and well prepared, tomato was perfect, potato wedges were off the charts, sausage was just fantastic, and the black pudding tasted like dried meat to me and it didn't bother me that I was eating blood.But the best thing we got to end the meal were berry pancakes (£9). Sweet and buttery strawberry and blueberry pancakes. The whipped cream on top was so thick (in a good way!) it made the pancakes all the better. Sweet blueberries and even sweeter strawberries with the soft pancakes created the perfect ending to finish off this breakfast adventure.The Breakfast Club is definitely worth the wait. Amazing food, amazing service, and good company makes this place an amazing place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The Full Monty! Bacon, sausage, black pudding, poached eggs, home-styled fried potatoes, mushrooms, beans, and grilled tomato!

kTV5IKwhln-BS65FCIXcDw.text: Is okay. Hearty, heavy, and calorie heavy comfort food.  Maybe too much. We couldn't finish it all.  Nice, sweet waffles.  But the fried chicken part was so-so.  They need a new recipe.    Okay hot chocolate.  Good orange juice.  But it works for breakfast, even if to eat breakfast for dinner.  When we ate here, it was rather late, but still loud and busy.

QPbUG81WJzlJjkShqPd7kw.text: Original location. You will wait in line. Super fun atmosphere and solid food. Had berry pancakes and chorizo hash. Both were very good. Service was great and fresh juice was delicious.

uNFZ5rDxAjO28A1YjVOIww.text: one of the best brunch places to go, although the queue can be a bit annoying, but worth the wait.smoothies are fantastic

vjElwg_oJ4LlnMWp2QV4Pw.text: Because I'm a Yelper and because I just love food in general, I wanted to do two things in London: try the Indian food and have a traditional English breakfast! With The Breakfast Club, I could check off my English breakfast wish - plus there were so many good reviews I had to check it out!Read through the reviews and saw that there was going to be a wait no matter what, still tried to arrive a little past opening time. Was met with about a 45 minute wait in a line that ended up stretching toward the end of the street. Not too bad of a wait!** AMBIANCE **The theme of the restaurant was very laid back and 80s classic, I loved the cute decor and the wooden tables were so aesthetically pleasing. I will say it's a little crammed in there, I sat SUPER close to the table next to me, I could've bumped elbows with them if I moved an inch. ** FOOD **I had the full monty and my friend ordered the eggs benedict. The full monty came out and it just tasted bland and underwhelming. Even the sausage was just meh. It was edible, it just wasn't that good. The eggs benedict fared a little better, it was cooked well and tasted alright - it looked quite nice on the plate! ** SERVICE **Not sure if I went on an off day but we waited forever for our food to come out. The waitress was also really attentive to the table next to us but not to us? It was a little annoying but at the same time they're a busy restaurant so I can't really fault them too much - I'm sure they do their best because everyone working there seems to be running around but they could definitely improve on their efficiency. ** VERDICT **So overall I think it's decent, but not nearly as amazing as people raved about. I was glad I got to try an English meal though, maybe I'll go back again one day and try some other things off the menu!

G84IZ1gj3KrsSIv2VO43iA.text: I stood in the blistering freezing rain in a queue for hours. The wind tearing off my face. I just had to try the breakfast in TBC! (Ok maybe it was calm silent rain in 12 degrees C, and maybe the queue was only 25 minutes, but it was raining and there was a queue).Oh well, great place, Best service by a guy in an apple shirt, lovely decor, nice playlist, amazing food. I had an avocado and bacon sandwich with poched eggs. Highly recommendable! Go get that bacon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

eUacrwkeFQHmk6iSwRJ98w.text: Cozy little place. The long queue outside might as well become a view in the neighbourhood:) Friendly and helpful staff. Amazing food! If the full Monty is too rich for you, try Huevos al Benni!

DdTas8HXq5rXScWBh4KsMg.text: Had to wait a long queue since it's one of the most popular breakfast place. I wanted to try out their pancakes but unfortunately it was unavailable that day. So, I ordered the waffles with fried chicken, it was okay. The chicken was over fried. Their English breakfast was very good according to my husband. I am not sure if it was worth the wait for me but definitely it was for my husband. I might go again to check out the pancakes  sometime

p25hDh2FXB0f4YkaaUwoHA.text: Great ambiance and delicious food! Friendly staff. We really enjoyed the pastries as well.

A-aZZb5t7s4LCvFUwmEyZg.text: I was disappointed with this breakfast. I had the eggs Benedict and it was marginal. The hollondaise was bland, the eggs were more than well done. Service was ok. Only thing that was outstanding was their green juice that was way to expensive to order more than one of and was over 3/4 ice. Not the worst experience but I wouldn't go back and I wouldn't recommend it

7k7RkNRlcMt32FhxdSKfNg.text: OMG! We reached here at 10:30ish after a morning appointment on a weekday. There was a queue when we arrived and an even longer queue when we left around 11:30. But the food is so good and the quantities humongous, that its no wonder that people make a beeline for this place.The coffee is amazing! Had a cup each when we sat down and asked for a takeaway each when we were leaving. I ordered the chorizo hash - to try something different and it was yummy. Didn't realise how large the portion sizes were and that my hash came with mushrooms mixed in it, otherwise I most certainly wouldn't have ordered the mushrooms on the side! The chorizo were the weakest element in this dish. I normally head straight for the protein in a bowl like this, but I enjoyed the crispy potato more.The Eggs Benedict were lovely - beautifully poached eggs and a lovely hollondaise.He assured me the banana bircher was very good - filling, nutritious and yummy. But it had bananas in it, so no way was I touching it. (I don't like fruits. There! I've said it! Don't judge me)Service was friendly and efficient. Everything on the menu looks so yum. The lady at the next table had ordered a pancake stack of sorts and EVERYONE in our section, was staring at her plate when it arrived. I also want to try their chicken and waffles. Food was pretty reasonable too for the portion size.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Amazing #coffee - picked up a second one to take away!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. #Eggs Benedict
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Chorizo hash

KnjkIEpBZSzdyuh3zgO83Q.text: This place reminds me of Franklins from Austin, Texas. People will wait 4 hours to try their bbq. I'm not kidding. I did it once. Anyway, the point is, it's fun to try it once. However, standing in the chilly rainy weather for 2 hours is very different than hanging out in lovely Austin weather for 4 hours. Whatever. Enough about the weather!I've learned that The Breakfast Club is an experience. You wait in the queue, because that's just what people do. The food is very good! I've tried the Pancakes, Eggs Royale, and Huevos Rancheros. We also had smoothies which were lovely. Would I come back again and wait in that line? No. But it's one of those fun things you do once.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast smoothies and oj
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with berries

FfxzSnsUvqqxc1FfMGw9jg.text: Be ready for the long lines- but the food is worth the wait!!!  Monday evening is BYOB!! Very small but cozy space with great music playing.

vqZeoZoTmhadMR4cTiddeg.text: I don't get all the hype. We ordered all American breakfast and chicken with waffles. All American breakfast was super disappointing. Poached eggs were overlooked, pancakes weren't fluffy and didn't taste good. Overall very disappointed especially after reading all the great reviews. Service and mint tea was good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and waffles
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. All American breakfast
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

mIKOVJmxkmKRJ2obmgc6zg.text: Food was typical breakfast food. I enjoyed the avocado toast and beet juice. Hint: do not use straws. Save the planet.

Ra2Os82VQ3r4CuhJgtqS_A.text: Tuesday morning, 8am, and the place was already 80% full. We got flat whites, a pulled pork sandwich, huevos rancheros, and a side of French toast. This place does a solid, no-nonsense breakfast. Neither the pulled pork nor the huevos were anything close to authentic, unfortunately, but it wasn't for wont of trying. Next time we'll be trying more traditional breakfast options, because the kitchen clearly knows what it's doing, and the home fries were amazing. The French toast side, for the Americans, is savoury egg toast rather than the sweet French toast we're used to; good, but be aware if that's not what you're craving.Prices are a touch steep, though consistent for Soho (think a tenner per main) but the portions actually reflect that, so you're definitely not walking out of here hungry.Bonus points for the warm, bubbly Scottish server. She was delightful.

mT3XrMmv1j3xi9DhU0Kxug.text: I was looking for a place where I could get a traditional English breakfast!  We found this cute, small, eccentric looking restaurant in Soho with a lot of character, and wondered in on a Friday morning and didn't have to wait.  The place was quite busy so I imagine weekend brunch must get quite crowded. We ordered the Full Monty (bacon, sausage, black pudding, eggs, hash browns, mushrooms, beans, grilled tomato, and toast), and the Eggs Royale.  Full Monty was amazing!  and HUGE.  It could be a meal for two, or a belly buster for one.  They also have a variety of fresh squeezed juices that were really good but pricy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Fully Monty (belly busting goodness)

OsVkNdy6cKzzMPu0dGHTeA.text: Yes, I like this place I really do. But like everyone else who actually lives in London, when you see a queue outside the breakfast club, you turn around immediately!There's nothing damningly bad. It's just SO. NOT. WORTH. IT. Today I queued for 50 whole minutes with a friend who wanted to see what all the fuss is about (fair enough) and so we waited.. Everyone else in line were most definitely tourists.I normally get the pancakes & bacon, and what can I say, it was decent, as always - fluffy enough (but could be fluffier), perhaps a touch bland and a little stodgy (though not off-puttingly so. I'm nit picking). Personally, Balans is my pancake place of choice. They are just much better - light, tasty, with crispy crispy bacon and cheaper! We also got the pulled pork burger, apple and cinnamon french toast and eggs benedict as well and alas, all similarly average. The poached eggs themselves surpassed expectations, as did the chips (which came with the burger) but really, nothing to shout about and I think we were almost desperate to point out something good.In short, at odd hours of the day, it's a nice chill place to catch up with friends, the decor's all kitschy-pick-and-mix-cute-kinda-comfortable, the staff are always friendly and the notes on the wall are a nice touch but NEVER AGAIN WILL I QUEUE TO DINE HERE. Just go to the one in Hoxton, it's usually far less crowded.Also, they've taken the chocolate caramel milkshake off the menu. MINUS POINTS :(

ruecb3THKWItdmukJ6v6pQ.text: Food was great, line was long but it's worth it once you get in. It's as American as it gets out there in London! I should mention that the portions are sizeable too so watch out if you're a light eater!

fHusP9Fy0ORcyLaQgdLqlg.text: This place was so recommended that I had to try it, and I'm happy I did. A friend and I came here on a Sunday morning at around 8:30 am (we thought the place opened at 9 because of Yelp so we wanted to get there "early," but it turns out they actually open at 8 am) and we didn't have to wait at all. As for food, I ended up getting the Pancakes and Berries, which I really liked. The maple syrup was AMAZING and the vanilla cream...oh my goodness. The fruit was also particularly good - which might sound trivial to mention, but you'd be surprised at how many breakfast places fail on the fruit front. The service was awesome too! Our waiter was friendly and the food came out really quickly, which was nice because we were both really hungry. The only reason why I'm giving a 4 star and not a 5 is because I would've preferred the pancakes to be fluffier. Other than that, the taste was great and so was the service and vintage-y ambience. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes and berries (syrup and cream on the side)

ZOaqgjNAM7d0YtsPE-KX0g.text: Get there early or be prepared to wait...although the wait is so worth it! Excellent Eggs Benedict and Coffee. Great atmosphere and close to my office right down in Soho. Couldn't have been happier with my first experience at The Breakfast Club.

vLbuQf_eXNoomMC9RH7klA.text: after eating around the city I must say that the breakfast club was amongst the top of the list. yes there is a wait...not sure why people get angry, upset, or hangry at the workers here when it was their choice to eat here. a few people came in while we were eating and getting upset. look, there are hundreds of places to eat around London. if you are choosing to get breakfast, plan on arriving no later than 840am. the breakfast burrito was delicious and they offer great juices and teas too. super friendly staff and a great way to start your morning. tip: if you plan on paying via plastic (credit card) be sure to tell your server you wish to add gratuity to the total. the 12.5% service fee is not included here.

85b9nsKTEkeuuOwY8wUuxA.text: This place lived up to its hype! Food was fantastic and the best part was the service.  The waiters here are adorable and so sweet- they made the entire breakfast experience totally enjoyable.  The place was packed out at opening time but now we know why!

nxmZWgHtjJGglHOV5Hkb-g.text: Got in around 9am on a Tuesday and to my surprise there was still a line out the door. Luckily, I came by myself so I did not have to wait long(15min). I got seated right away and reading other reviews and my love for the full english breakfast, I ordered the full Monty. Now it was about $15, which is more than the typical full breakfast. It was loaded however, with bacon, sausage, black pudding, eggs, potatoes, mushrooms, beans, a tomato and delicious Multigrain toast. There was nothing too spectacular about the meal, but it was very filling and I did not have to wait long. Not sure if I would wait over an hour as other people have, but I think for how long I waited, that was a perfect meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The line on a weekday
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The full monty

HhgBZ9k2t64PdDKQn4V9Gg.text: Quirky interior, walls plastered with foreign currency and postcards from around the world? Tick.Recognition that pancakes with berries and maple syrup are not a time-limited morning treat, but an all-day right? Tick.The biggest, most impressive and artful stack of American pancakes I've seen in London, drenched in maple syrup, berries and a wodge of whipped cream for a bafflingly-low £5.10? Doppel tick.Oh yeah, I'm a fan of this place alright. And their banana milk shakes ain't bad either.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Three of your five pancakes a day

WTPnSNlk4WHTBRMFTfu1xQ.text: The Half Monty (still a lot of food, even though it's not the full) and Reggie the Veggie were both delicious. Coffee was good, too! The queue on a Friday morning was only about half an hour, definitely worth the wait. Music was fun and lively, nicely contributing to the atmosphere.

Gx9bVr8PDVxqaMDzEZkPcg.text: Amazing pancakes with berries and cream. I waited in line for an hour and a half but it totally worths it. We got a shot of hot chocolate while waiting. Wonderful experience!

S1dkgeBkjQVetzDldTt7UQ.text: We were in Soho for an early morning (8am) breakfast. There was a line when we arrived before opening, however we were lucky enough to be part of the first few who were seated straight away. One of my friends is gluten intolerant and after asking the advice of the waiter, he pulled out a full list of what she could/could not have. He also didn't seem perturbed about going through the list with her, even though he could have made a fuss about spending so much time answering her questions (very good service). When breakfast came it was exactly what we had wanted and the coffee was fantastic! The turn around time from ordering to delivery was very quick too! Even though a large table had ordered right before us. Although I had heard great things about The Breakfast Club, it's nice to experience it and know it lives up to the hype (without any pretentious vibe).

OQWYkgYRfzbg87b-ljF6qw.text: This is a great little brunch place, tucked away off of the busy surrounding streets. It's easy to find with its bright yellow facade and long line out front (even on a weekday morning). But we were seated within 10 minutes or so. The wife ordered a flat white and the chorizo and potatoes dish while I stuck with Coffee and the All-American (pancakes, eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, and an angioplasty). Servings were HUGE and neither of us could finish our plates. Staff is very friendly and the kitschy interior has an obviously distinct vintage 80s vibe. As well as an odd introduction of Elvis throughout. The menu will give you a few chuckles if you read some of the commentary. And where can I get me one of the mugs?!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Flat white and coffee. Cool mug!

MGgFXmlChSEwsVJ9NXXm_g.text: When you get there, you may have to wait in line depending on what day and what time you go. I went On a Sunday morning around 9am and there was 1 home oil in line but then they left and I just had to wait for a guy to finish paying his bill. It has a very homey feel inside, with random decorations on the wall including an old metal sign. The tables are like something you would find at a garage sale or your grandmas attic. So it felt like you went over to an old family members house for breakfast. I forgot to take a pic of my food but I got the Vegetarian All-American which had pancakes, eggs, veggie sausage, and roasted potatoes. They definitely give you an ample serving of whatever you order so its definitely with the money. Everything tastes delicious. One thing that was different about them that I like is that they serve dressed pressed juices and smoothies. You can watch them making your juice. I got the Slow Boy; which had apples, carrots, orange, and ginger. While we were there the back dope was open to let in some breeze and a drag queen came to the door and was talking to a guy sitting near to it. I thought the drag queen was his friend cause he was laughing but then later one of the staff came over and said how he thought the drag queen was the guys friend but then he came around to the front and was bothering people in line lol. The waiter was like "welcome to Soho" lol

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate

sy047O5u7XaRYDWsrAXWeg.text: I'd never heard of this place but we were in Soho and we fancied an omelette & chips. So we googled "all day breakfast Soho" and this place came up first. It was 19:30. So we rushed to this place and were delighted to see 5-6 different egg options on the menu. However soon afterwards, the waiter announced to us that they don't actually serve breakfast that late in the day. I mean, come on! It's the "Breakfast Club" the one thing you should serve all day is Breakfast!Since they have eggs in the menu (and I would think a frying pan) I don't see why they couldn't just make the omelette but there you go.Tip: if you do manage to order, stay away from the chips and the guacamole. Both very disapponting.PS: there's no link between the classic 80s film and this place (not that we expected it but it just makes the name of this place even more pointless and an enigma).

ZHtZvr6JZsF3I09lPDxgxA.text: I order takeaway form here about once a week. It is breakfast euphoria in a box. I'm not joking here. Yes, there is a long line. Yes, it is small and crazy. None of that matters. The food is amazing. They have the best eggs Benedict I have ever had. The staff here deserve an award. For as busy, and crazy as it gets, they are still the most pleasant people you will encounter that day. They have to be taking happy pills.Pros:* Great food* Amazing service* Large portionsCons:* They never have cutlery for takeaway* The queue* The price is a little high for breakfast

p13MYITgjyiL7xT9rrOO3w.text: I have been to both of the locations but actually loved this one the best! Came here super early on a Thursday morning and we were very lucky to get a table, ordered the Bircher Muesli which was amazing. My family ordered dishes with tons and tons of bacon so I was pretty happy I was able to steal a few or maybe 10 pieces from them. Best bacon ever. They also have green juices which is genius and always a must. Will come back here when I'm back in town :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Slow boy

lwmNnfbU2yz4Qm9pnEu_yg.text: What can I say? It was a dinner that I won't forget any time soon and for all the wrong reasons. Horrible food, poor time keeping and dreadful service, the perfect recipe for a disaster. How can The Breakfast Club get it so wrong? You would imagine a brand new restaurant operated by someone with no hospitality business experience would commit such  a mistake, but The Breakfast Club is a multi chain business with years of experience and significant investment behind it. Even with the 50% off offer, I still didn't see it was value for money and there is no way I would ever want to visit it again. Oh did I mentioned they have one of the most annoying websites?

jLW9pRNT3rBfP1CDqjZz8w.text: Loved it! You're getting the most ridiculously fatty food, but I would say it was worth it-the atmosphere the waiters old-school songs, loved it all!

a48uMws9DhpgrfxwKNjr_A.text: So we got to this place, say 10ish... and already there was a line outside which we also joined before we could get in, eventhough there were free tables for two, the group of 7 before us had to be helped first, a bit weired to leave a table unoccupied just because the first group is too large to fit. The food was proper and the guy working there was very friendly and crazy in a good way. All in all it was an average experience given the price, quality an the waiting time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Full American Breakfast :D
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Poached eggs on chorizo :p

e4Km38rtwuYRDdXM46VpBA.text: I ordered the eggs Benedict. It was mediocre. I wanted my egg yolk to be oozing out as I dug in, but it was overcooked. Instead of hollandaise sauce dripping off the sides of my eggs, I got a couple dollops. I was disappointed with the food, but service was great!

6ahvz-EOGgsdbdIRjamD_g.text: Still popular and has a wide range of food. Still the place to go if you want a lazy brunch and then intend to shop. Must come early because the queue will build up. Friendly and warm staff with very good service.

sLWzwJ_Q3Aq_Iv0bTeYDOg.text: I had the full Monty. Great taste, though a bit slow.I had to queue for about half an hour, but it was worth it.

vvkh7umejXDt6f-2idUL5w.text: Had to brave the cold and a 30 minute wait but it was more than worth it! Food was excellent but service was better. Happy waiters sung along to American songs from the 60's 70's and 80's. Very small venue but a ton of life in it! Must visit place

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The All American

o9_VqaGlUumtWOuESEsHyA.text: Having been several times to the Battersea branch of the Breakfast Club (which is significantly larger in size), I was surprised at the line to get in. After queuing for almost an hour, we were finally seated. The food was very good, with speedy service and the waiters were upbeat and friendly. The only think I think could improve the experience would be to have some alcoholic drinks on offer - it isn't brunch without a Bloody Mary!

bPdFBEHkGwBFjiFfqsM43A.text: A very comfortable and cozy place where to eat an amazing American style breakfast, or brunch, or as us a late late late breakfast. We tried "the all American" dish, a huge portion of pancakes with bacon, eggs, fried potatoes and sausages. I also had a mango, strawberry and apple smoothie. Everything was so good, but the price is a bit high for a very "cheap" meal. By the way, I love American kind of food, so I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

XKWDVKC5snzSe8Gfq9LDAg.text: Waited 40 mins outside with a small child after seeing the good reviews the management and the server here is very rude and stuck up. The food is nothing special they make you wait outside on purpose longer so people can see the lines and get hyped up about the place there are so many other good options around here with a lot better attitude. I asked them if we can wait inside because my child was freezing and they said no even though people on the line were welcoming and told us we can even skip them to sit down he came out and said did she skip you guys after the people told him no and then I told him your attitude is very bad he tells me thank you and then I asked to talk to manager she had just as bad attitude as him . They see it as they don't have to treat costumers right because alot of people come in here but this will soon end I make sure I will never come here again and let everybody know as well not to

ym3gYbfrkbQhwaE2PZIRuA.text: Fantastic. Was walking around Oxford Circle and was lucky to pass by this place. Saw the menu and walked in. My wife got the veggie breakfast and I got the fried chicken sandwich. The food was great. Only complaints were the meat substitute. Needed... Well it needed something to add flavour. I also added some maple syrup to the fried chicken and it made my day. The BYOB makes it an extra special touch. Can't wait to go back.

z8ucMaoGHEaA4FSwrAChNw.text: Good fun American style breakfast. Get there early though as its rightly busy. Not sure what lunch and dinner would be like.

8uNgzzNK-VGqJbtUNthWxA.text: The queue didn't bother us but the terrible service and poor quality food did. The waitress kept dropping things, forgetting to bring cutlery, forgetting our orders - it was beyond ridiculous. The pancakes were completely flat and had a hair on the dish. The poached eggs with chorizo, chili and avocado on a muffin were great in theory but just too heavy and too busy. The Apple and cinnamon French toast with maple syrup was lovely - not soggy, a nice lining old egg batter on the thick cut toast. Whilst the rustic and simple decor is charming, the food was not entirely satisfying. I've been to other branches of this place and enjoyed them and the quality of the food more.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

lfoxc50pJqTiLjmtU8pHuA.text: Oh what a fun place for breakfast - we had the full monty because I heard their traditional english breakfasts were good and it was. The ham so eggcited was a fun surprise. So much food it was hard to finish! The coffee was good and black, too. We got there at 8 or so on a Saturday and there wasn't a line then, but there was one when we left at 9 a.m. Wonderful neighborhood to walk through, too.

fc2oQrlQYwnNVgs-GpoGGg.text: i've been here a couple of times, but even then I still don't get why massive queues form every weekend...The food's okay, not terrible. Pancakes are a bit on the heavy side (I prefer light and fluffy ones), and the eggs benedict arrived cold and lacking flavour. The orange juice comes in a really small cup for the price you pay too. I get that the servers are overwhelmed by the crowds and all, but service tends to be slow. Plenty of other cafes do great brunch (such as St Ali's, Lantana), enough said!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancake feast
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs florentine

Ci5M2Hnp5C34S_ZG7PMGaA.text: Queued up at the Soho one. It was nothing special could be an alternative to a fast food restaurant.We had a cooked breakfast. The food was warm not hot. Not much flavour. There was shell in my pancakes. I asked for extra hot coffee but it was warm so you could drink it very quickly.My 18 year old daughter who had wanted to go was unimpressed and we wouldn't go again let alone stand in a queue.

7z_lPvtxdEEVYQZofN8yHQ.text: Decent food, but quite pricey and heavy considering many other restaurants sell the same stuff for less, and with a quirkier twist. Not a fan of their smoothies, but their pancakes are good if you want to hurt yourself.

4VcjrvCPS_Lw4ZKGwd6qWQ.text: The food's good, the staff are very welcoming and they are good at catering for allergies. The prices are fair for London. The only problem is the long queue that can form here in the mornings. I understand that by keeping this in such a small venue, the queue grows and the venue subsequently increases in popularity and renown, but the food really isn't as good or unique enough to warrant queuing for an hour or so to get in (though often you're so hungry by the time you get through the door that it does seem like the best food you've ever tasted!). Honestly, I'd say go if you can get in, but otherwise avoid the queue and go to any one of the nearby hotels and cafes offering similar breakfast fare.

qDe_vM0UGG0XXdr5-XkKAg.text: This is a really fun place!  Love the vibe here.  The food is delicious as well! Always busy, but the line moves pretty fast.

_j7_OhKbSCYduJ6Y-Lt-Iw.text: I first arrived and seen a line and thought the place would be great. Sorry to say this place was just ok. The pancakes were thick and dry. I enjoyed the eggs and home fries though. The place was pretty tight, but so are most places in London. I would just order bacon eggs and home fries, next time.  No more of those pancakes.

P6Tn1eF61wFUBoJ6s0Ynpg.text: Took my brother in here in the middle of the afternoon one day last week and was pleased to finally see there was no queue. I think it's quite ridiculous there is such a queue all day every day, it is frustrating because its a great place but who wants to wait outside for 30-40 minutes on a weekend ? Every time I end up going elsewhere instead of waiting. It has that hipster feel to it, it's "a place to be", which I like but I'm not bothered enough about to wait that long. Having said that, once inside it is indeed the ideal breakfast place, the look and feel are spot on and the food absolutely great at a totally reasonable price. I do understand people hang around at the tables for a while and have to say that despite the resulting queue I do think its nice the staff respect a lazy lunch instead of encouraging faster turnover. Over all I'm half enthused half frustrated ! Would go again if there is no more than a 15min queue.

-JmdBXFfANb5kymKbTpZKA.text: Well, we TRIED to eat here. Waited in line outside for almost an hour....the line barely moved....nobody came out to update us or take names or anything. Would've been nice to at least get a little acknowledgement from the staff at least.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

9x3Whj3YMOsPojp6bvIdUQ.text: We ordered the breakfast burrito, avocado and egg breakfast sandwich, side of hash browns, pancakes with berries and juice. My bf loved the breakfast burrito! He usually hates breakfast burritos but the combination of eggs, meat and veggies was delicious. My breakfast sandwich, on the other hand, wasn't anything special. For some reason I thought it would be more like avocado toast but the bun was soft and eggs a little runny. It lacked flavor. Then pancakes were super fluffy and delightful. The whipped cream and berries provided a good balance of sweetness to the pancakes. Both juices we ordered were good too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Avocado and egg breakfast sandwich
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with berries - yummy!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Hash browns - super crunchy and delicious

6owzJfIX38XZT29sOMIykA.text: The Breakfast Club is a pretty popular breakfast restaurant in London so of course, as visitors, my husband and I had to try it. There was a line when we got there, but only maybe 7-8 groups before us. We waited about 45 mins - 1 hour at 9:30am. It wasn't too bad, except that it was cold! Inside it is cozy, but there was sufficient space so people weren't on top of each other. We were seated along with another couple who came in after us. The food was great, not amazing, but great for London. My husband is a breakfast lover, so we always have to try different types of breakfast food from wherever we go. So onto the food:Avocado & Poached egg- avocado with lemon and pumpkin seeds on rye bread with a poached egg on top. This dish was good, but then as I was eating it, it became too lemony for me. However, still great!Pancakes with Berries with a side of bacon- Pancakes stacked with whipped cream and berries. Pancakes were great, but not the best we've ever had. It was a bit on the dry side compared to what we are used to. The bacon was good, as expected.English Breakfast & Green tea- the teas were just okay, nothing to write home about.My only complaint is that the waiter took the order of the couple who came in after us first and they even had their drinks before someone decided to come to our table to take our order. A bit of disappointment, only because one should be taking orders from the order that people came in.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Our happy face mugs with green and English breakfast tea
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Front of the Breakfast Club

7Xx5CyIAWkelep_8hJ41AA.text: Excellent service and high quality food.  Our server was fantastic ~ very friendly.  Great way to start our first day in London...

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

CefD7ua77C4SREFGdCuoLQ.text: This was the only bad meal we had during our week in London.  Years ago, food was sketch in London, aside from fish and chips, Indian, AND the full English breakfast.  I've had many breakfasts in Inns throughout the UK and they rarely disappointed.Now the food is terrific all over London imo.  Alas, this breakfast place was both bad and expensive.  I'll give it two stars because the service was alright and the ambience fine.BUT, my full breakfast was marked by potatoes that had obviously been fried in old oil and tasted like they'd sat over night.  The "pancakes" that others in my group had had were the worst we've ever had.  They weren't fresh!  They too had been cooked earlier.  But since we were among the first group seated around 730 am, there was no explanation for why the pancakes were pre-made.  Note: I was in Tesco's and saw that pancakes, like the ones we endured here, are sold pre-made in packages, the same way scones or bread is sold.  No wonder they suck.  But we assumed they'd be freshly made in a restaurant.The bacon had an odd taste.  The egg was slightly off tasting.  The sausage link was barely edible.There were four of and we all ordered different dishes, so it's not like one of us had a bad meal.  We all did.I hate leaving negative reviews (and rarely do), but this place disappointed.

XgjDHClezr3AV9wVyBKi_A.text: Nice space. Very small for the extreme crowd they get. It was good but I don't get the super long lines.  It was just OK

V1ZMJsxCs_P8SfQgRVMpWA.text: Why is english breakfast so much better than american breakfasts lol. It was so good. I came to London for the very first time and had one goal in mind: get me some english brekkies. This little place had great reviews so we decided to go and have a taste. The wait was about an hour since the restaurant is really tiny but so worth! I got the waffles and the monty which were both super great. First time having black pudding and I loved it! Tastes like korean sundae but not as good haha. The service was great and their iced tea was bomb. My friend doesn't even like breakfast food and she quite enjoyed herself. Will defo come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

rmM5FyA6B4UGcEjZjVEpCA.text: A super filling "breakfast" that made me fall into an immediate food coma after. The whole menu is for those who are seeking a breakfast suited for champions.(1) Elvis Milkshake - Peanut butter and banana milkshake. Thick and creamy.(2) The All American - A pancake lovers dream if you're hungry enough. This set includes maple syrup pancakes with bacon, sausage, sunny side up eggs and potatoes.(3) Chorizo Hash - Not sure if anyone can have this for breakfast. This really made me full the entire day. It's packed with potatoes, Chorizo, bell peppers and onion.Breakfast is always a good idea, for anytime of the day.--voodie rating: 7.5/10£15 per head

Wl4skhIpBO3BR72UOlHxBg.text: First time here we are from California. The food was delicious my hubby brought me here and I'm glad he did. Establishment was very friendly highly recommend anyone to come in and enjoy the food. Ig @xxfidelxx

Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. First time here we are from California. The food was delicious my hubby brought me here I'm glad he did. Establishment was very friendly

G1PnifNB-LslM0EaNGBAsg.text: Came here for a rather late brunch (I came here around 4PM, and the line was still out the door!) back in December. I did like that they had a couple of vegetarian options, and I eventually opted for their Reggie the Veggie breakfast platter. Food was tasty, décor was fun, and the waitstaff were pretty friendly. I remember their coffee being quite good. They have a few locations throughout London, so if you're hankering for quirkier takes on the standard full English breakfast, stop by one of their locations!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Reggie the Veggie breakfast platter

Wd1-H1EMyTZK9t9d42NjXQ.text: It's been 6 weeks since I had breakfast here as a tourist from Australia. Thanks to my shocking memory I can't recall too many details but I still want to do a short but positive review for any tourist in future , like myself, doing some random surfing for breakfast places. Very popular, retro style, friendly service, great food , juices, coffee. Really enjoyed this place , nearby Spitafield Market where we went afterwards. We love London, pity we only had two days this trip.

wgnv3jzcwA22OO886c158g.text: Be prepared for the long wait. We came here for brunch and there was already a line waiting outside the restaurant. It's not very large of a space inside so I can see why, but it's worth trying!We had the avocado toast, and the full monty. Both were really good, but of course I love me some avocados! Aside from that we had ordered juices which were tasty as well. Decor: Hipster vibeService: Quick and attentive Food: GreatOverall, will come again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

4Id15lVjML_J8iKAvQoICQ.text: Man the line was long for this place. Cute small restaurant. Service was great. The have a wall of money people left with little notes on it which I thought were cute. I got the traditional English breakfast. The eggs were over cooked but everything else tasted awesome.

Ftvz0BvQASOJvVwI4XzFdQ.text: Great vibe here! All of the dudes running this place are super friendly and accommodating. Finally a properly poached egg! Praise God!!! Also the oat milk latte is A+... bit disappointed with the vegan pancakes, very tough, not really pancake consistency, otherwise 5 Stars.

bf0WBF6_VBx23a2Q1-AN3w.text: WORTH THE WAIT. Hands down the best chilaquiles I've ever had in my life!! We came from California, USA and waited a little over an hour, as the line was literally out the door! Cute quaint place, fresh pressed juices, friendly staff, AND THE CHILAQUILESSSSSSSSS!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

Plzudzaxgm5vX4ijsRnAAA.text: Followed the recommendation online & friends. Came in at 8:15am alone and was easily seated. But as I leave around 9am, there's quite a line outside already!The restaurant itself has a warm and cozy vibe, and the waiters are welcoming and really nice. Got the full monty, which is a plate of full English breakfast. It does taste pretty good, I especially love the sausage and bacon. The sunny side egg was fried with running yolk which is just what I prefer. It's not "AMAZINGGGGGG OMG" but I think as I am just wandering alone in London, a hearty and warm breakfast with friendly staff is all I need :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

q8PDthu1quMePgAemnHYcQ.text: First-time here in London and friends who have been there insist that I try this! Reached the cafe at 1030 and was told that it is a 40 mins wait for my table. The wait was worth it! Ordered The fully monty and the salted caramel banoffee pancakes! Definitely one of the best breakfast ever!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

Edm0XUEbvqHja7EwVIZWZQ.text: My husband and I came to this restaurant on a Sunday around 1:30pm. There was about an hour and fifteen minute wait before we were taken inside to be seated. The restaurant is very tiny, but cozy with lots of character. I ordered the berries pancakes with potatoes and bacon. My husband ordered the sea salt caramel pancakes minus the banana with the chocolate on the side. We both thoroughly enjoyed our pancakes and bacon! The pancakes were soft and fluffy and the fresh cream on top just took it up another notch! We also ordered tea which was just hot water with fresh lemons and ginger, but it was delicious as well...perfect for a cold rainy Sunday afternoon! I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in London! P.S. The staff is amazing and cheerful and they play a great mix of music!

JVc2jUS0Vu4mtorS7EwZfw.text: Get here EARLY! There is always a huge line (I think we waited ~1-1.5 hours). I think that the food was great (and the coffee too), but not sure how worth it was for the wait. I love the whole vibe/interior - there's a bunch of notes and photos on the wall. Definitely a classic place, but again not sure how worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast burrito

ThDK0fK3Nf3dGn_wKpboaA.text: This place was a perfect stop on our vacation in London over Christmas.  We arrived at the height of brunch, but there was only a short wait to get a table.  We all longed for a proper English breakfast and did not disappoint.  We had a vegetarian with us, and the menu had plenty of choices for the entire crowd.  Noise level is perfect and the atmosphere is Grade A.  Located right down the street from shopping and the tube, it was a fantastic way to begin a long day of sight seeing.  We were glad we stopped in.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

feb4-0Mds6jIWUpoVx3a4A.text: My first time in London, I asked around for a good breakfast place. Warned of its popularity but good food, I tried it. This place did not disappoint! I had the eggs Benedict prepared with ham hock on top of roasted butternut squash (optional instead of English muffin) - So good! With the Flat White on the side, I was in a good mood after several bites. Music is loud but thumpin'! Prince, Chaka Khan, certain rock , somehow didn't distract or disturb. Small place , nice staff , be prepared to wait, but eat well.

mp8g3wyC-1tP0YxUdpcMMw.text: The best breakfast I have had 4 a long time had the American style one yummy latte highly recommended really nice atmosphere too reasonably priced food & fresh juice amazing was deffo worth the 50min wait

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. American breakfast was epic

m7fWXplApLbbSoaQRmwRmg.text: Fantastic breakfast food.  I would eat their pancakes every single day for the rest of my life. The restaurant was pretty loud but that was my only negative takeaway from the experience.  I went at night so I was able to avoid the extremely long lines.

h6fKzHS-gThYbFoKEzy8Iw.text: Went today around noon for brunch, and we waited roughly 1.5 hr for a table. I didn't think the wait wasn't horrible as they had free wifi and the very nice hostess/server provided the password.  I caught up on a few YouTube videos to pass time.  We ordered the Full Monty and The American Breakfast. It looked very good on plate but I was slightly disappointed.. It was just very average at best.  My husband didn't even finish his plate which is very rare.  Perhaps us Philly folks are spoiled by the endless brunch options in our city.  If you're not up for waiting in a long line, you might want to skip this and find another place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The Full Monty and mint tea

2Iht7oXMOInoC3YgDfEmWQ.text: I bookmarked this place a while ago, so i was glad when a visiting friend gave me the perfect excuse to show him "a very popular London brunch spot".We got there around 1 and there was a huge line, but we decided to persevere. Shortly after we got on line, and huge group left, so we developed a sense of false hope about how quickly we would reach the front. And the more time passed, the more we felt committed, and afraid to relinquish our spot only to face another line somewhere else.One hour later, we're finally seated at a table for 4, next to another two-person group. It was annoyingly intimate, but whatever, we were hungry, and I figured that liquor would make everything better.Alas, after flipping the menu over 10 times, we realized there was no liquor to be had. What is the point of serving brunch without alcohol, honestly?Then our waiter comes over. We quickly tell him what we want because, after waiting over an hour, we're starving and trying to salvage the afternoon sunlight by getting in and out, especially since there's no liquor to linger over.The waiter then makes small talk with the couple next to us, and loudly notes "Thank you so much for asking me how I'm doing. You know some people just come in and quickly order and forget that I'm a person."So here's the thing. 1) All the aforementioned awfulness. 2) He immediately asked us "What can I get you?", not "How are you doing?", hence we responded with a food order and not a conversation.At any rate, I ordered the Veggie All American. The eggs, potatoes and vegetarian sausage were all good, but the pancakes tasted off. Also had a side of French toast, which was a-okay. But the waiters comment left a bad taste in my mouth, literally and figuratively.The great irony of our initial interaction with the waiter, is that at the end, when we paid our bill, we tipped 20%, as is custom where I'm from, whereas the other couple tipped him nothing. Wonder if he preferred the cash or conversation.

LUEA2fUh6zKJ0uhZmRL8xA.text: Yup, really great breakfast.  American or traditional British breakfast - the food is good, eggs are delicious..because of the location and great food expect for this place to be busy. Nonetheless, it well worth it. Qs is good for kids? they're selling breakfast, if your kid eats breakfast then you're good - don't share your morning's cocktails

6yipYnkM67yaybRnEH74Sg.text: The food is good and it's a great concept. However, queues always way too long and it's quite dirty inside. A good hangover spot.

ekNA2ngNrS-RGNdoy40QuA.text: The Breakfast Club is one of my favorite places for brunch in London. Of the 6 or 7 times I went I never had a bad meal! I only visited this location once and it was just as good as the others! The queue out in front was only a thirty minute wait in the sun, so it was quite nice. Once we were seated the service was great and our waiter was very nice and accommodating. The orange juice is delicious and I ordered the Huevos al la Benny (a Mexican influenced eggs benedict). The food was amazing, despite the fact they don't crumble up their chorizo, they leave it whole... it's weird. I really like this location but I prefer the Battersea one because it's closer to home.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos al la Benny, orange juice, the American breakfast, side of mushrooms. I

MRUO7BbJIeSAhwR-JfNrsw.text: Overhyped tourist restaurant. However, the portions are slightly bigger than average London dishes so if you're looking for an American style restaurant then this is the place to go. The pancakes were a bit too sweet in my opinion. The banana porridge wasn't too good either.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

pTurtk7rVFBOk1-Gju4hig.text: - Quaint diner decor: check.- Unreasonably large portions: check.- Crispy bacon: check.In short, this is the type of food that you can find anywhere in the States. It's American food, but I'm not sure if it's extraordinary American food. I ordered the apple & cinnamon french toast, and I loved the caramelization on the apples. I also appreciated how my "side" orders of scrambled eggs and bacon were served in their own bowls filled to the brim. Yay gluttony! Since I came on a Wednesday afternoon (breakfast is served until 5pm), I have no horror stories about long queues. I would really like to give this place 3.5 stars, but I'll round down to 3 because I do not foresee myself travelling out of my way just to eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Apple and cinnamon french toast, with "sides" (read: full bowls) of eggs and bacon.

X1n6sR-PrIhSGKQyDtbjoA.text: One of my favorite places to eat when in London. Great pancakes with berries. Also the american(vegetarian) was filling and tasty as well. Happy and welcoming staff. It's always a long wait however it's worth it..

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Coffee.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with berries.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

m23W87Sj1CVqaId3F4OHBQ.text: + ALWAYS massive queue, consisting largely of tourists + Minimum of 30 mins wait in the morning + Tasty big American breakfast but certainly NOT WORTH the wait There is always a lot of people waiting outside. For some reason almost all of them are tourists. This time, I got here at about 10.30 on Wednesday morning. Still, a pretty long queue. I waited for about 40 minutes to be seated. I have been to the one in Old Street too. But I feel this one (in SOHO) is the busiest hence the queue longest. As you'd expect, inside the restaurant feels a little crammed and busy. I ordered All American breakfast, which consists of pancakes, two eggs, bacons and roasted potatoes. Potatoes with caramelised onions had a nice flavour of rosemary and other herbs. Pancakes are nice and fluffy. But the main attraction of this place, for me at least, is the generous portion though I suspect it is not comparable to real American size. My verdict is that as charming the place is, it is surely NOT WORTH WAITING FOR 40 MINUTES. Really, why are there queues on weekdays? What do those people do???? (I don't count. I'm in between jobs so I'm ok.) If you are curious though, my recommendation is to order one of the American combo breakfast things, marvel at the portion of it while perhaps exchange some remarks with your friend(s) about the way they serve sweet and savoury on single plate and get it done with. I would feel no compelling need to come back twice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. All American Breakfast
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Front

ZQWEpbpT_sbmAOWlXRoIIg.text: I visited breakfast club at the request of a Friend visiting London. I can't fathom why anyone would queue up for an hour in the cold to pay £10 for a breakfast I can just as easily whip up myself. Not sure if it was an off day for them or it's the norm, but their breakfast was...well, very standard. I mean, how good can breakfast get? It's one of those hipster places that wants you to pay more for breakfast when you could get it cheaper elsewhere! Admittedly though, the decor was nice, and the pancakes were good, but definitely not worth waiting that Long.

ld66urzrCKlwaf5xWzxNnQ.text: One of my favourite places to have breakfast. A must when in Soho! The combination of savoury and sweet flavours is incredible. Due to its increasing popularity always a long queue in front of the restaurant. Tip: book a table during the week.

8Cjp3z5Ys2ykp54otcYSuQ.text: Went here with my coworkers since it was around the corner from our hotel. Ordered the Full Monty, which was a solid breakfast, and I certainly had no complaints, but I didn't think it was anything special. There are definitely a bunch of other delicious looking things on the menu, so I'll probably be back next time I'm in town.

2Gq1S2FRiTOnzR9OdZsvvA.text: I have no idea how I heard about this place, but I'm so glad I did! The queue does start early and run late. We go there around 11 AM on a Thursday and only had to wait about 10-15 min. When we left almost an hour later, the queue had stretched down the block. Get there early!Ambiance is nice- mismatched tables and chairs, Pac-Man art on the walls. We ordered the fresh squeezed orange juice (why don't more places do this in the states?!!) to start. I had the Reggie the Veggie, a full English vegetarian style with beans, potatos, eggs, toast, veggie sausage, roast tomato, and mushroom. It was more food than I could possible hope to finish. My boyfriend got the Full Monty (full English) and almost cleaned his plate. He hates blood pudding but raved this one was done properly and ate it all. Considering the line outside, we never felt rushed or unimportant. The price was good for the amount of food we got and we were full til dinner time. We will definitely come back next time we're in London and will recommend to all our friends!

4j8QDktmUNpbB8t9AZGfXA.text: Not bad, but I don't perfectly get what the hype and the lines are for. The breakfast (full american) was pretty good, as expected. My friend really enjoyed her smoothie as well. Coffee was ok. Overall, breakfast as usual.

GlgSEHhJtcjxd7z1njaOqw.text: Good but not worthy for queueing for 1.5 hrs. Very heavy breakfast. Bacon was not nice, way too oily and hard to chew. Smoothie and coffee were good!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes were less tasty than French toast
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

Vnts3vP-ahzqwxrFBlSS3g.text: got the reggie the veggie while my friend got the american breakfast + carrot ginger lime juice (really good combination of flavors)waiters were sweet but not so attentive when it came to service.the pancakes for the american breakfast were a bit bland and not very fluffy but i enjoyed my english style breakfast for the most partoverall this store is a great idea for a small breakfast/brunch type place but i think some of the menu items could be executed better. as an american who loves brunch, maybe my expectations are too high but for the area it's a pretty good deal for the food you get.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. reggie the veggie

8mvYBubPmq1K6T8jsPrGIQ.text: Absolutely lovely! Huge portions of delicious food, pancakes are great if you have a sweet tooth! Just be prepared for a long line

D9ze4kKlwp9-K0xnTCqLTw.text: Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day, so my husband and I braved the queue in the drizzle to try this place on the second morning of our London honeymoon. All things considering, the line wasn't so bad--about 35 minutes in a Tuesday at around 9:30am. In order to get another couple out of the rain, we agreed to sharing our table. Unfortunately they didn't speak much English, so we didn't make any new friends. The inside is incredibly eclectic, and we had a great time reading notes and drawings left in bits of paper and money from around the globe as we waited for our food. The eggs florentine was delicious--the eggs were poached perfectly. My husband's berry oats concoction seemed small, but it was incredibly filling--and we loved the lingering taste of peanut butter. It took quite a long time to get our bill after we were finished, but that might just be my impatient American mentality.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs florentine
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Berries, oats, nuts and peanut butter
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The walls

FzI_MFG-DXJgEjeszOg1Jw.text: Based on the reviews I read I had high expectations for this place. It was one of the few brunch restaurants that served a more traditional American menu. Since I'm not keen on a British breakfast, this seemed like the place to go. It was a Sunday around 11:30 and the line was quite long. Based on the reviews I had read this was expected. We waited probably 4mins - 1hr. The host that was managing tables was very nice and informative. He continued to keep us updated on how much longer and when we could expect a table. While waiting in line I noticed that the crowd was definitely younger (majority under 30) which seemed a little strange. The atmosphere inside is nothing to write home about. I wouldn't call it charming. I guess you could say quirky but overall unimpressive. It was quite crowded and they had very few tables. We ended up being seated at a community table with four other people. I was disappointed because they changed their menu after 12. It seemed weird for. Breakfast place to change over their menu. I ordered the eggs Florentine with salmon and my mom got the berry pancakes. Both dishes were good. A solid meal and a hell of a lot better than most other English breakfast choices. However they didn't hold a candle to come of the breakfasts I've had back in the US. I guess it's all relative. My eggs Florentine was cooked well. The hollandaise sauce didn't have much flavor. I didn't like the bun it was served on. It was too thick and tasted like the bottom side of a hamburger bun. Moms pancakes were very good. The serving size was very large. It came with plenty of berries and a lot of homemade whip cream. The cream was very good and so sweet that it really didn't need syrup. I did end up using some though because I thought the pancakes were dry. The orange juice was not fresh which was a bummer. I thought about giving this a three star rating but I thought it wouldn't be fair since it was a good breakfast, fast and had friendly service. I don't know that I would wait an hour in line for it but I also don't know of the other brunch options that London offers. So this may be as good as it gets.

iMd1zGCJU0ed7NutJGWHVw.text: I was excited to try this place and was even more sure it would be great when there was a long line at 9am. Overall, it was just average. I got the salted caramel pancakes and could barely taste the caramel - instead I was overwhelmed by WAY too much cream piled on top. The veggie sausage was nicely seasoned unlike many others but was definitely an unexpected texture. Finally, the oat milk latte wasn't my favorite - I couldn't really taste the oat milk flavor. Overall, I might come back but I definitely wouldn't wait in a line again.

oHaf3h_GYZpJA66i96kqiw.text: My girlfriends and I stopped in here for breakfast on a Friday morning after walking by and being drawn in by the bright yellow color outside of the Breakfast Club. We stood at the front of the restaurant waiting for a hostess for a bit, but when she did come by we were happy to see there was a table open for us. We asked if we could sit at one of the open tables by the window, but she told us we could not sit there because it wasn't clean. Okay.... We would have gladly waited for it to be cleaned off, but that didn't seem like it was an option for us. When we were finally seated we ended up ordering a bottle of champagne, orange juice, eggs benedict, avocado toast on rye, and the salted caramel banoffee pancakes.
