All of these were extremely delicious! The ambiance in here is great: some old school, hipster vibes. Although the food and the atmosphere were decent, the service was sub-par. We waited a while to have our orders taken, and after we finally got our orders in it took another 20 minutes to wait for the bottle of champagne, and another 10 when they realized they forgot to give us glasses. We also ordered water which came with bits of a black substance floating in it (coffee grounds perhaps?). Either way, it was a bit unappetizing, and the entire carafe was filled with these black pieces floating in it. Even the glasses they gave us for the champagne were dirty and still had other people's mouth/finger marks on it. Two thumbs down on quality control. Overall, this is a cute place to stop in if you're looking for some decent breakfast with a cute hipster vibe- but don't expect a 5 star restaurant across the board.

u-PLeHupkp0dJW0vOBH7nQ.text: This is a groovy, little place in the hippest, little alley in London. I guess it's a chain, but this is the one we went to, so.Anyway, dig the alley, cuz yer gonna be standing in it for a bit. This place is tiny and popular, and that's a recipe for waiting. No worries. Totally worth it.The food is the tops. The service is warm and inviting. The atmosphere hip and funky. Everyone here has 1. College degrees or are working on it 2. At least one Gang of Four record 3. Backpacks or satchels with pins/patches on them. Now, you know where you are. My kinda place.The tables do chairs are small and stiff and square, but the food and company smooths out the rough edges.She got the bennie, I got the avo toast and both were scrumdiddlyumptious! On the way out, I got me some stickers!!! YAAAAYYYY!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. They're quite aware of what they're going through...

L31dbvqwLGEi8P3EESeQlg.text: Came here because I was visiting London and wanted some classic English breakfast. Got to the location 30 mins before open, to my surprise there were already people eating inside. I got a seat right  away and soon enough had my breakfast in hand.I really enjoyed the sausage and beans. The eggs were cooked perfectly. How they managed to cook the eggs with out any crispy edges is still beyond me. Service was good even though it eventually got busy.Lastly I'll say I understand why there's a wait for this place. Not only is it really great food but the restaurant itself is small.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

g_2jDMEjJ8JJxW92Ui-MKA.text: Went here solo on a Friday AM.  Arrived exactly at opening time, as I've heard there is notoriously a huge line.  No line at arrival, seated immediately, but there was a line ~45 mins after opening when I was headed out.5 stars for ambiance - very cutesy breakfast vibe inside.3 stars for prices - especially on beverages - super expensive.4 stars for food - my pancake stack with bananas, caramel and chocolate was more like a dessert.  It was so delicious but way more than I could eat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

RBXVdf5BqvPw7js5GVOTvQ.text: Had a few hours before my early afternoon flight and decided to stroll on over to the breakfast Club. I took a longer route from my hotel to do some site seeing and wish I hadn't because right at opening time there was already a massive line out the door! The employees were quick when it came to getting people in and out of the tiny little establishment. However, they did this in a way that wasn't overbearing and making you feel like you need to rush. Super cool guys running the shift! I was torn between the Chorizo Hash and Huevos al Benny. Ended up ordering the Benny! The chorizo sausage was really tasty! Had a nice zing to it and went really well with the avocado on the Benny. They even mixed lemon into the avocado which is a crowd pleaser for me! I got the potatoes on the side and that was probably my least favorite part of the meal. Don't get me wrong, they were good! But they were missing some variety of hot sauce ( would pair amazing with chipotle). The FRESH squeezed orange juice was DELISH. Ordered two because one just wasn't enough! They sell pitchers too for those coming in groups. Will be coming back and sampling everything else on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

BeFFDw2-_Dr618KK9J1DbA.text: Well although in line for 2 hours the wait was worth it. The food was excellent. I had chicken and waffles. And met some cool peeps I ended up sitting with.

iROcIbF3AENqiuBdO8D7xQ.text: For my first meal in London, I opted for The Breakfast Club.  After getting lost a few times I made it. To my surprise there was a nice sized line of people waiting to get in. A staff member came out and gave each person an estimate on how long it would take. Since I was dining solo it only took me about 30 chilly minutes. Y'all it was cold!I decided to try the cabbie breakfast. It consisted of egg, sausage, bacon, beans and toast. I wasn't a huge fan of the beans but had to try a traditional dish. The bacon and eggs were cooked perfectly and the sausage had a nice bite to it.All in all, I was pleased.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

PzgRhL795vbN_badybTxVA.text: Loved this place! Definitely worth the 25-min wait outside in the rain. Depending on the time of day u go, be prepared for a line. I had their "All-American Breakfast" which tasted just like home. As an American, I tried staying away from anything we have back at home, but a full breakfast just sounded TOO GOOD to pass up! I'm a huge breakfast lover and the Breakfast Club has my seal of approval! ;-)The pancakes were fluffy, but were sort of plain and didn't quite have that "buttermilk" taste. They were still good though, especially accompanied with fluffy scrambled eggs and bacon!! Would definitely love to go back whenever I'm in London again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. AMAZING All-American Breakfast! Bacon, eggs, sausage, potatoes with 2 fluffy pancakes.

OfL8QUWTOK7Nr3JzzWPCpg.text: Came here on a Wednesday around 11AM and there was still a decent wait (we were told around 40 minutes). However, we just so happened to be the only party of 2 so we were able to get seated within 10 minutes which upset some parties ahead of us, but y'all know the rule regarding popular brunch places, the smaller the party, the better.Ambiance: Your typical 80s American diner (I can actually call it that because I'm from NYC) with a wall decked out with notes and currencies. Food: I ordered the chorizo hash, which turned out to be a huge portion (I barely ate 1/2 the bowl), but it was super delicious. My only critique would be that there would be less potatoes and more peppers/mushrooms/chorizo so that the ratio would be better. The boyfriend ordered the All-American, which sounds exactly like what it was. A huge platter of pancakes, eggs, breakfast meats, and potatoes. If I could, I'd give this place a 3.5/5. I personally don't think it was worth the wait or lived up to its hype, but if you're in the area and you're craving an American breakfast, this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

VxzQtDN3KMKllzerOQYS5w.text: I want to say this place made me think of home and traditional American breakfast, but they did it so well that now I want to move to London so I can get this breakfast all the time! And thank goodness for Yelp in London! Otherwise we wouldn't have known about this place! And boy did it live up to its name!I seriously wanted to try everything on this menu, but settled for the pancakes with fresh cream and berries, since everyone else was raving about them. And now I get the hype! Those pancakes really did something to me (in a food type of way). I could have eaten another stack, but did not want to be judged as that hungry American. The fresh juice was also delicious and refreshing. Not to mention the music! Talk about good taste! So if you're into a traditional American breakfast/brunch, you definitely want to check out this place and then walk the streets of Soho to walk off any guilt you may have from your gluttony. Other notable information is that this place is reasonably priced and can accommodate strollers (and we had a double buggy, but were able to take it apart and fit the car seats on the seats).Pros:-pretty centrally located-relatively priced-those pancakes and fresh whipped cream and berries!!!Cons:-relatively small-crazy queue on weekends, son be forewarned and plan early!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. View from door
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

x8GemmBlO6oVlBLwyUp90Q.text: The Breakfast Club is a super famous brunch joint in the heart of Soho. There will probably be a queue, even on weekdays, but the food here totally makes up for it. Their version of an English breakfast, The Full Monty, is the stuff that dreams are made of. Don't forget to order some pancakes to end the meal with a bang. You'll be all set to food coma for the next 5 hours!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Salted Caramel Banoffee Pancakes (9.50) - banana, vanilla cream, salted caramel & chocolate sauce
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The Full Monty (10.95) - bacon, sausage, black pudding, eggs, fried potatoes, mushrooms, beans, grilled tomato & toasted multigrain bloomer
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Beer Cheese Benedict (10) - pulled pork, beer cheese, pickled red cabbage & poached eggs on an English muffin

W80fak3Eb5OMLxmi5T-Zjw.text: This was 100% worth the wait on a Sunday. There's a very short list of places that I would wait in line for a second time, and The Breakfast Club has made that list.Food wise I had The Full Monty, and a shake. Both were executed well, and came out in a reasonable time.One final but, I went with my mother on mother's day, and they had a promotion where her meal was free, which was extremely nice of them to do.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The All American
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The Full Monty

bhx2_PrnhGnluPWXm8lqNA.text: What a brunch it was! Now, make sure you're prepared to wait a bit. When we got there, we were told the wait would be over an hour, however this led to a number of people leaving the line, and we waited only about 35 minutes. But man am I glad I waited. These pancakes have to be some of the best in London. I went for the ones with berries and cream, but the chocolate banana ones also looked heavenly. The eggs Benedict was also a solid bet, but I'm glad I went sweet, the pancakes were perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

EYc3XHoFYMt1qqfs_JWKbQ.text: So so yummy! Ever since I got to London, I had been dying for some pancakes. At around 7pm on a Tuesday night, my friend and I were walking around Soho for a bite to eat. We picked the Breakfast Club because who doesn't want breakfast for dinner?! This is the perfect place to eat before hitting bars and clubs too! My friend got the eggs florentine and I had the pancakes. The pancakes were served with real vanilla whipped cream and berries!! SO good! I loved the combination with their Canadian maple syrup. I also got a hot chocolate with multicolored marshmallows! It was amazingly creamy and delicious. My friend enjoyed her eggs as well and said it was very fresh. I've never been here in the morning but I'm sure it's difficult to get a table.. if you love breakfast, check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Fair Trade Hot Chocolate with marshmallows
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Florentine
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with vanilla whipped cream, maple syrup and berries - SO yum!

XojMxdCH_LiSLr18XTem9Q.text: I went there for a late breakfast, we waited in line for almost 30 minutes. The place is a pit small but its a friendly atmosphere. The food was ok nothing special about it. But I really had a great photos outside the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

4ilxs69J1FRRhBNlMWWgSw.text: Never understand the lines, which is almost one hour wait on the weekend. The food is actually very basic and have to share table with others as too many customers.

WdtCl4PdmNbLk11cdIo9Eg.text: Mate, it's THE spot I tell ya. I turned around the corner to find the place and I didn't have to look much further.. there was already a queue in place! Jesus! I believe I did wait 45-1hr for a spot in a sharing table with another couple but I don't mind.. I just wanted to eat. Luckily my hunger grew after waiting in that line so the food was all worth it. Ordered a proper English breakfast with beans and all and loved every bit! It was so fulfilling. Also superb fresh orange juice!! Honestly wish we had this in the states and not from concentrate. BONUS POINTS!! -- spotted Bollywood Actress Jacqueline Fernandez!! She was having breakfast with her mom and sis and I didn't want to bug them bc it is their personal time BUT! After they paid the bill, I went up to her and complimented her movies bc hell, she's great at what she does! I wish I had taken a picture with her tho.

V1szhJyjbHOqiTaMirFReQ.text: If you are visiting London, I recommend that you visit one of the many Breakfast Clubs, which are dotted around London - I am sure you will not be disappointed.  As the name suggests the cafe specialises in breakfasts and brunches, but are far superior to your run of the mill Full English.  just imagine smashed avocado, chorizo hash, eggs benedict (hipster-style!).I have attended one other Breakfast Club, but on this visit, I searched for one that was close to where my sightseeing would commence, and this was easy to find, and probably like most of The Breakfast Clubs, you will have a wait, but bear with it, because it is worth it.  I waited 20 minutes or so outside before being seated.Inside, was small, but had quite a mediterranean style, especially with the colours, but also the usual unique and quirky posters and framed photos dotted around the walls.I ordered the Chorizo Hash with added avocado, because..,, avocado.Absolutely delicuous!  Although I did recheck the mention to make sure I didn't accidentally order a breakfast for two as it was a MASSIVE portion.  Delicious chorizo hash with poached egg and grilled peppers and mushrooms, lying on a bed of caramelised crushed potatoes, and a dollop of lemon and feta sauce.  Oh my!  Oh, and avocado on the side.  Superb!  Even though, I was unable to finish it, I had no desire (in a good way!) to eat for the rest of the day.  I bought a salad in the evening, but I left that until the next day.  The breakfast set me up for the 10s of kilometres I walked that day.  Totally worth it!Next time, I am in London, I will be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Chorizo Hash with Avocado on the side

dDbGMQwX0OrczgbJ4su2pA.text: Despite a bit of a wait, this is the place to go for breakfast or brunch. Lots of variety, great portion sizes and good coffee. What more do you want? I've been a few times and will go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Waiting in the normal queue

_vdWb4mdKXIMjtgFPZc6zw.text: Terrible service!! The hostess was mean!! After standing in line for 20mins with a baby stroller and a crying baby she wouldn't let us sit!! Not returning to this place ever again!!

DRzNI4HXSCsD927wdEesxw.text: If you can get past the crowded feel, this little place is delightful! I popped in an hour or so after they opened, and was lucky enough to get a table by myself on a weekday. Definitely loved the trendy/hipster vibe inside. I have a major weakness to anything benedict or benedict-like, so I ordered the Eggs Royale (Smoked salmon on toasted English muffin with hollandaise), which came with a small side of greens (spinach?) drizzled with a vinaigrette. Definitely liked it a lot! Also got an fresh-squeezed orange juice with my meal. Overall, I was pretty happy with my meal. I do wish that the portions were a wee but more. Also, one of the poached eggs were a bit more overdone than the other... which I found odd, and the taste of the vinegar or whatever they used was a little too detectable for me... But overall, I would still come back for another meal!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs royals and an OJ!

GXGIV_UCK4TthCU4JUF13A.text: Love the pancakes here, im a regular! Love the all american breakfast

tMQjYEhdVQmYZTEgVmBnnA.text: The breakfast was very American-esque. Taste was good but there are definitely better and cheaper options if you don't care for the nice feel or location. I'd recommend the freshly squeezed orange juice.

aRFXO96bC3A15EgDXa7oaA.text: This is a really nice, chilled and relaxed place to grab some breakfast. I've been a few times, had some breakfast meetings there and taken clients too. Like most place's in London, it can be busy, but the service is great and the food is really well made.

QHjiJxAJ1WsP8Fg8d6PU0Q.text: A real hotspot for brekky! We loved the pancakes with berries, the cream is just out of this world. So delish!! The eggs royal weren't as good as promised but the service was really good and I'm def coming back. Juices taste very good as well

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancake with berries
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs royal and pancake with berries

Bijef1i6OLp5xj8t9ps1Gw.text: The best breakfast in London I've ever hand - Huevos Rancheros :) And I've had some good breakfasts. Staff are the nicest and friendliest people, vibe in the shop is as positive a pure sunshine and their eggs are killing me softly. As everyone in here, I hate to queue outside and that is the reason why I only came once. If they would manage to find something bigger or solve this problem other way while keeping everything else as it is, I would be the happiest.

ig10o5e9V5E3Rx4eEhv-cg.text: I had heard a lot about this infamous all day brightly coloured breakfast venue- and finally after two years in London I got to sample the deliciousness that is a Huevos al Benny at 2pm on a Sunday. Ok I had to wait in line for an hour, but the staff were really attentive and kept us updated with wait times. Apart from the amazing food, and singing staff, the venue is quite quirky and had an eclectic playlist going- all aids in helping the Sunday recovery session. Trust me- it is worth the wait!

rQpnoVIHLRbaSdAafAjqPw.text: If you have the day off work and are in the mood for pancakes, go to the Breakfast Club.Anyone who hasn't heard of it, its basically a brunch style restaurant which cooks up breakfast delights including bacon and pancakes and other bits like burgers and burritos.We decided to share some chilli beef nachos and a stack of pancakes with berries and vanilla cream...seriously if you order anything, SHARE IT - the portion sizes are like something out of the flintstones!I can honestly say the pancakes are some of the best i've tasted so make sure you order a stack..after munching our way through about 2/3s of our order, we felt like we were about to give birth to a food baby so the staff let us mooch around for a while slumping on the table. The place has a really chilled vibe and they have a jukebox where you can request songs and the whole place is filled with quirky decor. there's a couple scattered across London in Hoxton,  London Bridge and Angel so i definitely recommend a visit if you're ever near by!

YcCbrqLIvsHIGaQbm0r81w.text: Always busy but the queue is worth it for a nice comforting breakfast! Often have the eggs royale as it feels like a real treat!

fnW80f96fv2xQa3D9BBbkg.text: We waited 45 minutes because of all the hype on Yelp about this place lol it was a mistake.. I got the All American and my fiancé got the half Monty and we were not impressed at all. The pancakes were very bland and everything else was whatever. We actually felt kind of sick after eating here.. Not worth the wait.

nvt_TSdq-gITFIFP8K18yg.text: Quick glance:+ great staff+ filling "breakfasts"+ quirky decor- long queues I've heard so much about the Breakfast Club that it was time I visited. The Soho branch is the original, and there are now other Breakfast Club in various locations around London, including Shoreditch and Spitalfield. I was catching up with an old friend over Saturday brunch so we met outside the venue at 11am. I have heard about the queues but I thought I wouldn't mind since we had a lot to catch up on. It took an hour to get in, so it was technically lunch by the time we ordered. On the plus side, one of the staff came out at some point to hand out shot glass size of their fruit smoothies to appease us. The restaurant is tiny and quirkily decorated, reminding me of small American cafes you see in backwater, touristy spots filled with memorabilia left behind by tourists from around the world. The selection of breakfast items is fab - you can have a full English breakfast, American pancakes with the works, huevos rancheros, or you can opt for the healthy stuff like porridge and muesli. I ordered the huevos rancheros since the description was mouthwateringly delicious and I wasn't disappointed. The plate of food came quickly and it looked better than it sounded. And the taste? Even better!The "mains", if you will, seems expensive for breakfast, at under a tenner, but considering I subsequently couldn't eat another thing the rest of the day I would say its a bargain!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos rancheros, yum!

0EpwtNSEmqNJbXChDmGM9g.text: Was quite disappointed with this place... The reviews suggest it would be amazing, and the price and the long wait makes you think it would be, too. The food was OK, but definitely not standout. Everything was soggy, the potatoes were drenched in oil. Had their big breakfast... I've had better for less than half the price elsewhere. Overrated!!

lEN69H1S674o0JNTr79DVQ.text: Unique and cool café with quick service and a lovely menu! Well worth a possible wait!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

LH1QmdZRjl7RMpDK7NcDkg.text: I recently stumbled upon this place on a layover in London.  My friend had always wanted to try this place out but was discouraged by the long wait times and lines.  It just so happened that I had an early arrival time, so we made it on time here before any lines had formed.  This place is really tiny, hence the long wait times.  I'd say there were about 10 tables in this small restaurant, so come early to avoid any wait.   My friend ordered a Half Monty, which was a smaller version of the Full Monty, basically a real English breakfast with bacon, sausage, beans, 2 egg, and toast.  I ordered the All-American Breakfast (typical, huh?), which consisted of 2 pancakes, bacon, sausage, 2 eggs, and potatoes or fruit. It was pretty good, though I would consider American breakfasts in America a lot more satisfying to the tongue.  The bacon was really good.  The pancakes were not so fluffy, but the maple syrup that came with it was really good.  I enjoyed the hot chocolate here.  It was very chocolate-y and tasted delicious.  The service was pretty good, though the restaurant was a bit cramped yet cozy.  This is a great place for an early morning meal but a little over-rated in my opinion.  I wouldn't wait anymore than 15 minutes to get into the restaurant but it's good to try.

LerbFQo9UsEwLrBXWtvYEw.text: I could go there anytime. This place was suggested by a londoner friend and he was not mistaken. It might be a little crowded, especially on weekends; but you don't wait they very much in line. The food is great, the variety and the possibility to have brunch or breakfast whenever you want make this place absolutely lovely.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Great brunch with friends

zrS6f2VPu1NkG8JBc7qPGA.text: Had brunch here to power a day of tourist walking in London.  We had hoped to beat the lunch rush by getting in well before 11 but still had to wait a bit in the queue outside to get a table.  Once seated we ordered the full monty and eggs bennie and a couple coffees.  We had to remind the waiter on the coffee order and he apologized and got them out straight away and mentioned they would be on the house - excellent recovery I say.  The food was excellent, my wife says henceforth all eggs benedict should come with ham hock.

DKOPm9afjp_u3vGjqHiCrg.text: The atmosphere is cool, they have polaroids and lights hanging and play a lot of red hot chili peppers and arctic monkeys. The food is pretty good too. They have a few good vegetarian options. Definitely try to come early or late to avoid the line which can be brutal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Bacon pancake
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs florentine!

ZZPLi5rxai8wC5LPg9aQUg.text: I walked in and already felt relaxed. Woody furnitures mixed with an industrial vibe that will put you in a sunday mood even in the middle of the week. The menu, of course, was all about breakfast: the pancakes and berries are soft and fluffy, the whipped cream on top is incredible, the hollandaise on the eggs benedict is delicious, the " home style fried potatoes " sort of sweet but in a good way, and the coffee is good. The staff is chilled out and friendly. And nobody cares if you want to have pancakes at 5pm. Really enjoyed it!

iMdlDquftHKnQyyrio7C1Q.text: I felt really comfortable eating here, it definately filled the spot! Quite a cosy location. I enjoyed the pancakes and the smoothies were a must have! Everything was really fresh and at an affordable price. Great for family breakfasts or a meal out.

EeCiziEA4Dvs07ltRfptwg.text: This is a great place for lunch, but gets very busy and doesn't have that many seats. The food is always great, with a good choice (unless you arrive late). The cakes/traybakes look fab, but I've never had a chance to sample them. The fresh orange is really good and they make an excellent cup of coffee. The reviews above have made me want to try the smoothies and waffles, so I'll be back to order them next time I'm in the area

O-IOYiZoxi2ZyI8d9-Ixtg.text: I've walked pass this place many times and always wondered what it was like behind the bright yellow exterior. So I was pleased when a friend suggested we go there. I really liked it. The place has a great vibe - really relaxed and friendly. A welcome antidote to the many chain places around and to me captures the spirit of Soho. I only had a coffee, which was only ok. But the huge sandwiches my friends had looked great and were enjoyed. I will be going back to try the food for myself.

STxxucsA5P75lgDAf3tvCA.text: This place is great to stop to grab a bite or to have coffee. It is good because you can get free wifi connection as well so it means you can still do some work if you want. The food it good too, you can choose from a traditional cooked breakfast or have waffles or toasted sandwiches or maybe even a smoothie. Their range of smoothies are great. It is made there when you order it so you know it is fresh. This goes for the juices as well. The coffee is good quality too.

cxGX0u7krZUQv4QPrYwv8Q.text: Mom and I stopped here on a Friday morning because she wanted brunch, and I hadn't gone out to breakfast since the last time she was in town. Upon arrival, we discovered a line. Outside. On a weekday at 11. This place had to be good. The long-haired, somewhat overwhelmed waiter assured me it would be five minutes; I was skeptical and started yelping other places. Five minutes later I was eating my words as he sat is down at a communal table. And by communal I don't mean a long wooden table with a few chairs between me and the neighbors. I mean legit communal, like sandwiched up next to a couple enjoying their full Englishes.Mom and I hovered for a bit, then got over it and decided we were too hungry to care. And honestly, it didn't matter in the least, the food was THAT GOOD. I had the Breakfast burrito (sans chorizo) and Ma had the Chorizo Hash Browns. We tucked in and didn't notice each other, let alone the couple squeezed in next to us. Halfway through the meal two burly American guys took their place. Send em in, I was quite at my leisure.I finished with a flat white and Mom had an Earl grey. Both beverages held up the standard.Some more pros: delicious food, speedy service, lovely yellow front, plentiful condiments at every tableCons: grungy interior reminiscent of a punk club except not dimly lit, tight squeezeI'll definitely be back!

GJX2NMW79qppk0MAwnlsqg.text: I am sure that many of us, at one time or another, would have come come across the extraordinarily long queue that snakes through the lanes of Soho and ends at the Breakfast Club. It seems that there is a permanent wait to get in here. So it did not come as a surprise to me when I had to wait outside in the freezing cold for 45 minutes on my first visit here. However any anguish was more than made up for by the food. I ordered an English breakfast (the full monty) while my friend went for the huevos rancheros. He liked it very much, especially the chorizos. This came as a bit of a surprise to me as I thought that the sausages were the weak points of my breakfast. But they were more than made up for by the eggs, bacon and the black pudding. My favourite breakfast drink is the banana milkshake and the Breakfast Club did not disappoint on that. A pretty heavy brunch set us back by about £15, which is not excessive. But I don't foresee many visits here. The long wait is a turn off and there are many places which are at least equally good closer to home. But if I spend a whole night drinking in central London ... then maybe ...

NVXoY_vwwp9zScmsnxek7g.text: As one would hope the Breakfast Club is a great place to get breakfast, particularly at the weekend. It is perfect if you're feeling a little worse for wear and need that health/junk mix as they sell traditional greasy spoon fry ups, bacon sandwiches and wonderful smoothies (the Blue Monday is particularly good). The staff are friendly and there are a couple of comfy sofas at the front, though the rest of the chairs in the back are a bit hit and miss. Also, whenever I go they seem to playing feelgood cheese anthems. A good place to go for well-done English cafe food and smoothies, though I'd avoid during peak hours in the week when Soho's media population descend and eat lunch with their Macs.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

35fFIQci6xTWQ2HX22-YKA.text: Get there early, because it get's full in there fast, but totally worth it! Awesome food, good service and great atmosphere :)

u79pwk276SjCDTnv3mddlw.text: This place got packed quick and there was a line out the door on a Sunday morning, understandably. It's kitchy on the inside and felt like it was straight out of film of the same name. Very 80's.I got the full monty and my friends got he breakfast burritos. I'm from Texas so breakfast tacos, burritos, and taquitos are a God-given right there, so it was nice to see it across the pond. My friends enjoyed it. It's a good breakfast joint.

0XWaZOAqArTP5iC0G4_61w.text: Oh Breakfast Club, how you disappoint me.I've heard so much about you. Everyone says how awesome you are. You smell of pancakes and bacon and magical things from my childhood. You even have coffee mugs with freakin' Pac-Man on them. And yet, you left me feeling dirty.Dirty because my entire visit to your establishment was tainted by little tiny flies buzzing in and out of my face, my chai latte, my friend's haloumi wrap, and taking my patience with them.Now, I should base my review on the food, yes? (I didn't eat anything but my friend's food looked amaze.) My chai was nice, but it was served in a cup without a handle and I couldn't drink it for a good 10 minutes because I was afraid my finger prints were going to disintegrate if I held the glass for more than two seconds.Flies, in my experience, equal DIRTY THINGS. There must be sticky, scary things on the floor of this place. I appreciate it's been hot this week. I appreciate that with windows open, bugs get in. But this was not one fly. This was an extended family of flies, including all of their inlaws, all hanging out in one particular area - MY FACE.And so, Breakfast Club, I give you two stars. Not only for the flies, but because you may have altered my identify forever by stealing my fingerprints.

tK2PJ3MrTQTfZjeekBS4-w.text: I am re-reviewing this place because I'm *SO* sick of getting the wrong order! The first time I went I loved it, but the last THREE times the service has been terrible and I'd been given something I didn't ask for. I wouldn't mind, but by that stage I've been so hungry I've just eaten it. Epic fail Breakfast Club. I'm so disappointed and I won't be giving you another chance. Hire some more staff for god's sake!

AyE6MnYsxQEWjByoX6tTwQ.text: One of the things I miss most about London is The Breakfast Club in Soho. I can't count the number of times I rolled out of bed, grabbed 4 friends, and headed down to The Breakfast Club for some hot greasy (in a good way) breakfast food and a smoothie. The place is small, so most of the time we waited for about 15-20 minutes for a table for 4-5. If you dont like waiting, go in a smaller group, but I was happy to wait week after week for this amazing breakfast. The breakfast burrito is my favorite, with powerful chorizo packed into a bulging tortilla of egg, guac, cheese and probably some illicit drugs. I take my breakfast food seriously, and lucky for me, so does the Breakfast Club. The staff is so friendly and the kitschy wall decor is always a good conversation starter. If you sit in the back on the left look in the drawers for a notebook full of memorabilia left by other breakfast lovers just like you. It's pure heaven.

CPEktZA8YlgKrBegMHteTg.text: I was in Soho London with 2 friends from WDC  USA, and we all enjoyed The Breakfast Club a lot , you can have real  breakfast items , pancakes to die for , and many many more choices of breakfast  selection , it is located very close to SOHO on a small street , and it is more busy on weekends , versus to find a table during the week days, all is great , only thing they should work on is maybe a filter coffee option , may be a tastier coffee should be better like other famous coffee houses in soho area in London, but I still like to give them a 5 star for the tastiest items they got in the menu and a unique place to go in London :)) Thx guys The lebanese background British waiter was very nice and helpful :)) Sorry I can not remember his name though .

9ZCis_33z1zOmVHNbC1sNw.text: I can not really tell about the restaurant itself, because I was discouraged by the queue outside. Maybe it worths that, but you should be prepared to see a queue, at least Sunday at 1pm, and willing to wait long when you are so hungry for your Sunday's late breakfast :-)

uVw8X_XlWSSOyr-YsAys7A.text: My absolute fave brunch spot in Soho... The portions are HUGE, the smoothies are fresh, the coffee is amazing, the service and staff is great, and the neighborhood is spot on. I always anticipate my early arriving flight so I can hit The Breakfast Club and get my ever favorite dish there, The Full Monty. Bacon, sausage, eggs, hash browns, black pudding, mushrooms, tomato and a side of toast (as if you needed a side). Its such an amazingly delicious dish, that I am getting irritated that I am not in the UK right now to hit TBC tomorrow morning :( The pancakes are fluffy and delicious, served with warm syrup... YUM! Go to this spot, sit outside (if the weather is nice), and people watch. Oh, and call me to join you... because I will ;)

Dxu5xlU2BhtqaH9tNLvhiA.text: This one is a little hard to find - which may explain why it was quite empty when I went. On a friday night no less. But is still an amazing place to go - pretty intimate, nicely decorated, very friendly staff and delicious food for massively reasonable prices. BYOB is a delight and rare to find outside Brick Lane. A great spot for some nice grub and long chats with friends. Go with an appetite.

EfIveSkpD1t5QncThprVYA.text: Never before have I witnessed such a gigantic mountain of scrambled eggs and smoked salmon.  It was as if all the eggs from an entire farm had been scrambled onto one plate, coupled with a river's worth of fish.  It was so big I was convinced that it had its own gravitational force, pulling tabasco sauce into its orbit.  A small village could have feasted on that one plate of eggs.  But I digress. Given all the so-so reviews, I didn't have high expectations for the Breakfast Club.  But I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the coffee, the speed of the service and the mammoth portions.  Frankly they were so big as to be wasteful - when I finished it looked like I left a full plate behind.  My friend's eggs royale were better proportioned and perfectly cooked.  Call us satisfied customers.

U4tSwl0am6ulv1J4pR6qSw.text: Any dish is a mouth orgasm. Perfect student diner. Decent prices!

fW1qC6V53dURf5vY38EnqQ.text: although there is normally a huge line out the door, its worth the wait, the breakfast is spot on, its very quirky and a great little location! would highly reccomend

0anwYK_KhnNjrj3utKXe6w.text: Had a great bacon and egg bagel for brunch. My friends' English breakfasts were a little light on vegetables (don't recall any tomato - this is a serious omission) but everyone was happy with portions and quality. Mood carries this place. Yellow walls filled with bric a brac like covers of Bruce Willis albums (yes, albums!). And the staff care: about you, about their establishment, about breakfast. This is the first place I found using Qype and what fabulous results. I got converted to espresso at this place and it certainly packed a punch. Wonderful. The day's most important meal just got its own restaurant. I wonder aloud if one is allowed to eat here all day?

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

NRnV6gpny7Cjxh9p8gZTPg.text: Our first breakfast on the London leg of our honeymoon. This place certainly lived up to the hype. It was mid-morning on a Tuesday and the place was still jumping, but we got a table right away. It was next to a pretty breezy back-door alley entrance, and that's the only real reason for any points off this place. The Wife had Reggie the Veggie. Great eggs and a passable veggie sausage, but the beans for breakfast put her off. Sorry Honey, should have gone with the Huevos Rancheros like your "esposo macho"! As a self-declared Hueveos expert-o, I give this version high marks. Any time your huevos come with fresh guacamole and sour cream, you're already a cut above. The tortillas were laden with eggs and salsa, and the chorizo-less hash was a perfect side for the veggie-groom. All of this in an atmosphere so cozy, it was like breakfasting in your friend's kitchen.

Mm7sknZWhSTVl1qnKFr2DA.text: This is a fabulous little place with plenty of character with polaroid photos and notes adorning one wall, trinkets scattered about the place, fairy lights and almost everywhere you look someone has left their mark one way or another. There are a choice of different sized tables to sit at and an assortment of chairs which you may find yourself swapping about to get a more comfortable one. The brunch menu was one of the better ones I've seen in awhile but as soon as I saw the bacon and egg sandwiches the guys across from us had, I knew that I had to have it too. Just remember to order at the bar or you will end up feeling like a numpty wondering why they haven't come to serve you yet. The menu does state Order at the counter but since we hadn't yet had our morning coffee, we can be excused can't we? The bacon and egg sandwich was delicious and hit the brunch spot. They did forget our coffees which after a bit of prompting from us arrived just after our last mouthful. I can see this place becoming a regular of mine. Next time I visit, i'm ordering the porridge. Again spotted at another table, it looked incredibly good, even the glassware it came in. I'll just hope the coffee arrives in a timely fashion! Oh, and don't forget to pick up a free 'The Breakfast Club Soho' button when you pay for your meal!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

WLiyCUnhkNt7MDmT4Tubvw.text: I have to say, judging from the almost universally good feedback on Yelp and Foursquare about this place I was expecting something mind-blowing. Instead, I got fairly average food (I got the El Butty) that wasn't particularly worth the trip to Soho or the prices. Not really worth the hype, in my opinion.

76d4t8nWKYRbGRZWapJK_g.text: Brunch is my favourite meal, so I wasn't going to take my visit to The Breakfast Club lightly.  I've been anticipating my visit to this place for months.Maybe it was high expectations (which I consider to have been offset by being really hungry)....but the food was so...well....bad.  Food took forever to arrive and it came cold.  I had the Full Monty - the toast was like a wet sponge, the sausage seemed undercooked...everything was just so...tasteless.Decor is cozy and nice, but the first place we sat I had the air conditioning blowing in my face ...we moved and found a table where the table was about 3 inches too high from the seats (I even stacked up 4 cushions to sit at the right height).  Ok, so it was because I'm 5'1" (or maybe just have a really short torso???)...but still!Not a bad place to try, but am not going to go back.

aEjfuBRCOyyFt-99rCWylQ.text: Definitely love the vibe of this place! Sort of a wait but Great food I had the all American breakfast Pretty dang good

0gLib-5sGtu1NqSbJY-NPQ.text: Yum, yum, yum in an environment of fun. My breakfast and bloody mary was amazing and so was the service. These folks are obviously doing something right as queues are always in place on the weekend. Worth the wait, you bet y'all. This American Southerner in London will be back... maybe bright and early to avoid the queue too.

qhMyqD0vR4tUgg4whTX-Gw.text: Great find!  I thought this might be a touristy kind of place but it was not. Short wait to get in to this funky little place but definitely worth the wait. Our food was delicious and anything we saw being served to other customers looked just as amazing. The pancakes must be a hit because it seemed like almost every table had some.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

98f6peGEl9iWEIRoeLJdXQ.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a while as I always see a queue outside it no matter what time it is or which day of the week . Hence when I was up at 6am one morning , I decided to give it a shot . I got there just 7 mins past 8am, it opens at 8am and it was already packed but there wasn't a line . I had to share a table with someone else as they had already ran out of tables by then .  I love the energetic vibe of the cafe, and the enthusiastic and perky staff .  Their playlist was a highlight for me.  It definitely put me in a bright mood on a grey cold wet morning .  Unfortunately I can't say the same for the food . I ordered the pancakes with eggs bacon and potatoes and a latte . I was disappointed, it felt mediocre.  Ambience : 9/10Staff / Service : 8/10Playlist : 10/10 Food  : 5/10 Coffee : 6/10 I probably won't be returning anytime soon for the food . If there isn't a queue, I certainly wouldn't mind ducking back in for the music and vibe and trying their juices .

IzBGcqAbLmoNZgAU2sWiZQ.text: You won't find the Brat Pack at this Breakfast Club (yes outdated North American Joke), however, I did find some good conversation while having the one of many traditional English breakfasts in London. It's a cross between modern and diner. There is a charm to it. The breakfast was greasy, therefore, had to split it. Good prices and good customer service. Servings are super large. Or maybe it was just me and my eyes were just small that day.

4SH2kLxl8HnOPvUrYAbpHQ.text: Really nice atmosphere and good food.However, be prepared for a long que depending on when you go!Worth going though :-)

rRWPBuarkGtqJfDsN_5_DQ.text: This place was really hipster and lax. The food was amazing, except the sausage I had with my All American pancake breakfast was so greasy I couldn't believe it. It oozed grease and it made me feel kinda grimy. But the pancakes themselves were delish. Nice and small, but not too small. The shitty thing is that it has a seriously long line if you go at the wrong time (which is like, 11:00). But it was worth the wait I'd say (which was like, 15 minutes) because of the food but also cuz of the waiter. He was super charming and said stuff like, "Love" and "Ladies". He had a bunch of tattoos which was kinda bad-boy-esc, which I can dig for sure.

y_9C6qgKLeBKwNxHQDxRQg.text: A friend and I made a late morning stop at this place on a whim. The queue was painless and the folks working at the time handed out lil smoothies while we waited. We were given the option to wait out for our own table or to share one with another pair of diners; ended up going with the latter, which worked out just fine.Menu is fairly extensive but not overwhelming. I love me a good egg so ordering the Eggs Royale Benny was a no-brainer. All their Bennies come with the option of swapping out the English muffin for a roasted butternut squash stack, and, okay, listen, I also love me a good roasted squash so I strongly recommend doing the squash thing.Worth the few extra £s. Both my friend and I enjoyed the food, the friendliness of the staff, and atmosphere here- we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. eggs royale benny on a butternut squash stack

rhvuQWUiiruuht45XlhmNw.text: It's pretty difficult to find a decent American breakfast in Europe. This is one of the good spots. As an American I obviously was required to order the All American Breakfast: Eggs, sausage, plenty of bacon, country potatoes, and two pancakes.First off, I'm a big eater and this was just the right amount of food. The bacon was the highlight. It was lean and there was about 5 strips of it. Sausage was good, although burnt. The potatoes were also surprisingly good, and the eggs (free range) were poached nicely. I would have given this place 5 stars if the pancakes were better, though. Sadly they are flat, unfluffy and dull. They use real maple syrup, but it just barely makes up for the poor flapjacks.The price was reasonable (for London) as well. It was £11 for the plate and £2 for a decent cup of tea.Overall this is a solid place to get a good breakfast, though be warned that if you don't come early you could wait in line for up to an hour.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Queue at 11:30 on a wednesday
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

eYZYcB3RZX8HKmHWkOTfgw.text: The good, the bad, and the ugly...Good:  The vibe was so (for lack of a better word) COOL.  The space is cozy and eclectic.  Bright colors, with charming decor. The three guys running the joint are efficient, but with flare and swag and a chill attitude.  They are people you'd want to hang out with.  Which made the rest of my experience all the more disappointing. I have to also say, the food LOOKED good.Bad:  Let me go ahead and preface this with the elephant in the room: I'm an A-MER-rican (think the Obama pronunciation).  I love pancakes and pancakes love me.  So when I saw the chance to try them on this side of the pond, I jumped at it.  Especially when I saw all the great reviews.  I usually don't give bad reviews much credence.  Especially when most people have a positive experience.  But I gotta tell you, this wasn't a good eating experience.  This review is for my hommies who are familiar was Cracker Barrel and IHop and even Dennys.  THIS IS NOT THE SPOT!  Not for pancakes.  Maybe if I had tried something else on the menu.  These cakes were so pretty to look at, but tasted of...nothing. And there were four of these truly offensive items on my plate.  Again, they looked good.  But they bare no resemblance to their American counterpart as far as taste.  They were thick and cakey and needed a lot of help in the form of maple syrup and BACON!   Thank goodness for bacon, without which I could not have stomached the customary half portion I wolfed down to be polite (I didn't want to be the rude angry tourist).  Ugly:  My face once I left.  I'm a good actress when it comes to faking the funk.  But even I couldn't keep up the pretense once I got out of earshot.  Oh Lawd please help these people!Some friendly advice to the very cool owners: -Add salt (no one is going to get diabetes from a half teaspoon) OR add some yummy bacon bits to your batter. - Check your recipe- pancakes should be light and fluffy, not cakey- Go on doing what you're doing.  The reviews tell the story.  Most people seem to like them.Some friendly advice to unsuspecting American tourist:-Don't get your hopes up.  This is UK style!  You're on their turf and apparently, salt is not a food group here!

jcEt_XcR9slXywk8K4Bbxw.text: This is the Breakfast of Champions! We waited in the queue for about 20 minutes. The servers were professional & nice.They even came outside in the rain to joke, inform people about the wait time.I ordered the Full Monty. The portion size was huge. I needed help finishing my breakfast and my beau was happy to help. There was a serving of avocado,  baked beans,  black pudding,  sausage,  scrambled eggs, ham, bacon. I really enjoyed my hawt cocoa stacked with marshmallows!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Hawt cocoa always taste better with a smile
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino & hawt cocoa
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Two full monty servings

_exQGTwtg6lIhlSSl8cUuw.text: I arrived for a late breakfast and was surprised to see quite the queue for 10am in soho. Was almost deterred, but I've waited through longer in SF... and it was quite worth the wait. I went with the Full Monty despite all the other tempting pancakes and egg benedict on offer. A traditional English breakfast which delivered as promised. A wonderful treat, filled for the afternoon of walking the British Museum, meetings and speaking later this afternoon.While the poached eggs were done well (as is custom here in UK), they were wonderful. The bacon was filled with flavor, but the sausage was one of the best I've ever had. Ordered avocado instead of mushroom, and on the toast with the sausage and roasted tomato... heavenly breakfast. I've joined the club. You should too.

LEZmtG6Y9C1kz7uijHeuAQ.text: I love this place!Cute hipster atmosphere in SoHo (I believe every restaurant in London is cute, lol) and not thaaaat spacious but it works.I went here for vacation and was craving pancakes.I got the pancakes with berries and cream (I forgot what it was called) but it was AMAZING!!! It came with a huge stack, loads of fresh cream, and lots of berries which is my absolute favorite!! The pancakes were super fluffy and paired perfectly with the cream, syrup, and berries. Usually I crave something savory so I took a bite of my sisters and brothers All American Breakfast and they were amazing!!! Cravings 1000% satisfied.Coming from California we don't have that many places like this in my area, so it was definitely lovely to have made it to the Breakfast Club. I wish I could say I would come back here soon, but it is unlikely. But when I get rich and famous and can travel the world. I'll be hittin up this wonderful country first. Until next time, London!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Cute cafe looking place, cool walls!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. SOOO YUMMY

_nDimWKxkQxpqUWBKuC4Qw.text: This place was on my mind after I left it the first time, I had to try something else the second time around because every thing looked good and smelled good. I had the Full Monty which is to die for. Now I am on to try something else.... hopefully I don't change my mind and get the Full Monty because it was that good.

40DuY2baaLuUMOVdyy3-Hg.text: Worth the wait! We picked this place because of the great reviews and the amazing pictures of breakfast. When we arrived (around 9 AM) there was a long line outside. We decided to wait and ended up waiting about an hour until we were seated. I didn't mind waiting but you have to wait outside and it was cold and raining lightly. They waited on us pretty quickly and the food didn't take too long either. One thing I noticed was that there were a lot of singles sitting at tables meant for 2-4 people. Would be nice if they sat people together or had more tables for 1. I had the avocado toast and it was good but the "toast" was more of a cracker (very hard) and the dish was very lemony. My husband had the pancakes with berries and I tried it and it was amazing. If you like sweet breakfast getting the pancakes is a must here. If we make it back to London we will go back!

iPicQ8oNg71fTg_ZYO8hxQ.text: (Late breakfast 10AM September 20, 2016)On our recent trip to London my daughter and I couldn't turn down an opportunity to try this highly rated restaurant.  What we experienced was a very good English breakfast with many options to meet our tastes and wishes.The food is very good but not exceptional and can be equaled at numerous other eateries at lower prices.I will not return on my next trip to London for the following reasons (neither of which is due to poor food):  1.  Average wait of 30 to 46 minutes to get a table, and 2.  once inside you will experience small uncomfortable tables with  a high noise level.

yeLLnjbfDI_qwtGEaraQwQ.text: Everything includes a post about the long queue, however, if you go at an obscure hour like 4pm like we did we were able to get right in with no wait! We loved that breakfast was available all day, which you might expect considering the name. The food and service were most excellent and the early 2000s American pop music was cracking us up. So good, highly recommend.

kdp1ypERtjkbxZCikeccIw.text: I don't like this place. I never have and i never will. I've given it plenty of chances and tried a few branches. Its mediocre food that sounds better then it actually is.

mjNVBKFAbkrVVLApIxdjhA.text: This was my first breakfast experience in London and it did not disappoint. Magda was very kind and informed on the menu. We ordered both of her recommendations. Give her a raise, because she made it an excellent experience.

_2uEbIcZWZ9jAMUXOPsACQ.text: I've always been a fan of The Breakfast Club. Big portions, decent prices, and tasty food. Only caveat is to avoid peak hours because of loooonnnggg lines (no reservations, unless weekdays after 6pm). The Soho location is the smallest of the other Breakfast Clubs. The menu is smaller, eg) they only offer the Moroccan Chicken Salad (£8.50), and not the other 3 that you see on the online menu (Waldorf'ish Salad, Mardi Gras Salad, Rocket & Parmesan). I was in the mood for healthy, so was impressed with the Moroccan Chicken Salad. Portion was good and got full. It was fresh and not overly done with the tzatziki. The grilled red and yellow peppers gave the salad an extra meaty touch and flavor. Also, ordered the When Haloumi Met Salad Wrap (£8.30). It was delic. Came with a side of coleslaw and some lamb's lettuce. If you're not a fan of coleslaw, cancel it out. The mayo was oozing about and I didn't like it. The wrap was tasty- the balsamic reduction was on point and added good flavor. You can also request to make the wraps into a salad version. Next time I will probably do this because the balsamic would be a good dressing. The juice maker was broken during my visit, so was a bummer. Hopefully they've fixed it by now. It's BYOB after 6pm at this location.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. When Haloumi Met Salad Wrap, 8.30
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Moroccan Chicken Salad, 8.50
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The Number 3 Wrap- made as salad, 8.30

-vmuy6wmqRXPUhZhi_vxRA.text: The food was good, but pricey for what it was. Waited for 45 min today get in, and I'm not sure why the hype. Maybe because it's cool and hip? I guess... but not really worth the time or money imo... maybe it's a translation issue... huevos rancheros was good but not really what I was expecting...

tXa3ZUes9g8OxEScn4DYZA.text: Waited roughly 1 hour in the morning to eat here. It was definitely worth the wait. I needed to eat an English breakfast before I left London and I am so glad I came. Staff was excellent and atmosphere was perfect plus the food was real good.

ZpTPIueOGEaCL3a-OaNzQw.text: IT WAS PERFECT! we went there around 8:30 AM and we were lucky enough to not wait in the queue. Ordered the poached egg with salmon. It was DELICIOUS! Good vibes and friendly waiters as well as free wifi.VERY RECOMMENDED!

Gwj94s-O4YmSaNocIQ1N5A.text: This place is Grade-A FUN. My friends and I are (let's just say) frequent flyers here at The Breakfast Club. From epic hangovers, to casual hangouts, we recently came here for The Breakfast Club's rockin' pancake challenge -- did I do the challenge? no. should i have done the challenge? yes. -- and the staff showed us a great time.That said, the food is ALWAYS great. I usually get the All American Breakfast because, well, I'm American. Sorry... BUT my friends have gotten a dossier of items off the menu, and I'm sure they'd have the same reaction.TIP: there is always a long line (which is a good sign) so maybe bring some cheerios to hold you over....why I knocked a star: things can get unbearably slow when it is super busy -- the service staff, the food, getting the check. Perhaps if there were more staff on busier days, the line would go faster? We have waited (at least) an hour for our food once, making our total seat time about three hours!

s_JR-6chnLVOZo7gjh7EJA.text: Upon our arrival, there was a long line outside, however it went pretty quick and we were seated before our estimated time. If you arrive and their is a line, you just need to get into the line right away. They do not take your name for a list. Inside, the ambiance is casual and energetic (very upbeat music was playing). The waiters are very young and quick. It is a good location for a young and hip brunch. We ordered the huevos and the full Monty. I definitely recommend the full Monty. It is very good! Also, check out this juices on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos and the full Monty

wg9ykiEDyGv6Lf3z7dn2AA.text: Had a great brunch here. The brunch dishes aren't quite what I'm used to in the US (was pretty much just smoked salmon on toast) but still pretty good and great coffee as well. You must also check out the shore ditch location and go downstairs to the bar

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict and smoked salmon with eggs and toast

jM65wJzNtAoiqfJ9MR9U0g.text: You absolutely have to try the pancakes with berries!!!!  I got the All American and was able to upgrade my pancakes with berries... it was 4 pounds extra. It's a must try. I went on a Thursday around 1pm and was able to be seated within 45 minutes. The guy waiter was really nice and charming. The place was full and since I was only a party of 1, I had to share a table which was fine by me.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Outside
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The All American with upgraded berry pancakes... 4 pounds extra to upgrade.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

2jXOu4v6n3Ae7VaDowEfNQ.text: Make sure to go before it get's too packed! Be prepared for a non traditional pancake (by American standards) but none the less delicious. A fantastic breakfast spot - both for late night or morning - with great grub and a laid back atmosphere. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

Ikmvgg3RdWnJebJmFc2BPw.text: Pretty hard not to like the Breakfast Club chain; good wide selection of breakfast grub (eggs all the ways, fry-ups, muesli & porridge, smashed avocado etc.), and decent coffee in a hip location (and if you are lucky, with a secret bar somewhere hidden through the kitchen).Be prepared for a wait in the mornings, almost any morning, outside the door in a queue. Your best bet is to get there bang on 9am, or just after 10am as the first wave or two of hangry customers filter it and tables open up. Probably a bit overhyped to be completely honest, but it's one to knock off the list!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

ph5_V8ZKk2EY1wDU3pMkFg.text: We waited in line for about 1.5 hours.Let's be honest; that's a really long time to wait for breakfast.But it was worth it. The staff were really nice, and the food was amazing.We both got 'big breakfasts' which were so good!The coffee was great, and so was the fresh squeezed orange juice. Our juice was served with ice, and when we told the waiter we didn't realise it would be served that way, he took it back and gave us new ones.The environment is really good, although the music was a tad loud.Overall, it was definitely worth the time it took.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Left: Half Monty with extra avocado. Right: Full Monty with avocado instead of black pudding.

2l9lfhAWx8_MI4EBpWGhcA.text: After reading so many positive reviews we had to visit while on our London trip.Arrived at around 10 and had to wait 30mins i queue, but it was absolutely worth it!Ordered the Full Monty, Pancakes with berries, green smoothie, orange juice and two coffees.Everything was perfect. Cozy little place with great service. Food tasted delicious and was just what we needed on a London morning. Easily worth the 30min wait. Recommended for everyone looking for a good breakfast. And we were surprised of how low the check was.Superb!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Always go Full Monty if you're hungry!

DXwTqr8bO0UG4pX8qWOJaw.text: I bookmarked this location based on the stellar reviews for the 'full English breakfast' search term and its location. I'm no stranger to queuing up a bit for brunch (as sometimes happens in NYC), so I didn't mind the wait too much, even when it was drizzling. I had gone on an 8K run earlier in the morning, so I was starving. Ordered iced coffees, Full Monty for me, and a Half Monty for my less-hangry friend. Cleared my plate and loved every bite of it.Service was super friendly and they played a lot of Taylor Swift. Iced coffee was quite good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Full Monty and Half Monty

98Xz4BMEtE843Q4jNfsOxA.text: Oh how I wanted to love this place. Especially after a long walk to get here and a 45 minute wait to get in on a weekday. I was just in London for 2 1/2 days, and this was the only meal under my control. I wanted a full fry up. I checked multiple places on the Internet. This place kept coming up near the top of the list.The short of it. Most everything overcooked and dried out. Fortunately, I was not as hungry as I thought I would be, because I didn't find enough that was good to make a full meal. Fortunately, I had a breakfast meeting at a nice hotel the next morning where I was able to get my full breakfast done properly.On the positive side, since I was a single at a busy time, I ended up at the communal table with another single next to me who was very interesting to visit with.

BjEl2KPOJzpsvdcF1uL0ew.text: I had the all American which was good. I substituted the potatoes for avocado. They served the pancakes with real maple syrup which was nice. The streaky bacon was perfectly crispy and crunchy. The only thing that let it down were that the pancakes which were a bit dry and crumbly. Venue is nice, staff are friendly and it had a great relaxed atmosphere.

d-gmbHWoe4n11C6QNKtFpA.text: This place is on my list for best breakfast places. First of all the atmosphere itself is five stars itself. All the decor takes you back to the 90's, its basically like stepping into a time machine. We have to queue for a good 45 minutes before we got a spot but the line moves pretty quickly. My friend got the vegetarian english breakfast and it looked pretty hefty. The potatoes were on point. I got the berries and cream pancakes and they were amazing. The pancakes are more cake-ey than I am used to, but I was surprised that i enjoyed it. Usually I like my pancakes light and airy but the way they cooked it worked with the berries and cream. The cream was amazing and so light. I honestly could have ate an entire bowl of just the cream and berries. All the staff were super kind and the customer service was on point. Even when we were waiting in line, we had staff members checking up on us, and we even had green smoothie samples. All in all if you are in the neighborhood, and you have time, check this place out. Tip: try to hit the place up before 12pm to avoid a long queue

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. berries and cream pancakes. The cream was so light and creamy. I could have eaten a whole bowl of just the cream and berries itself!

3HuNXTJa-LfuzxViT7Buuw.text: Got there 9 ish a Sunday morning & there was a line outside, she said expected waiting time is one hour!! And inside didn't look any special either so we just thought its one of those hyped places & decided to leave!

nCLYe8Eu7dfAOE9P0XKGqg.text: My husband and I visited back in June, but I forgot to add my review for this quaint breakfast spot while we were still there. We were looking for something unique and wanted to get out of Westminster and tour other areas of London. This had by FAR the most reviews (and top rated) so we took a cab to Soho to check it out. Walking in, (after about a 45 min wait outside) it was almost like a scene out of "Friends" or something. The place had a very 90's vibe - complete with the music, atmosphere and even the casual nature of the staff. We were seated and took to the menus right away. Great selection, I opted for a mocha and the Eggs Benedict. My husband had their best seller - the English Breakfast. Both were delicious and just what we were looking for. Despite the wait outside, we were not rushed to leave and it was actually quite calm inside, even though I know how busy it was. The ONLY reason I'm giving this place a 4-star instead of 5, is simply because of the wait, and it being outside. The street had an awful smell and it was dreary, so rain was off and on and just made the wait worse. I was hoping and praying that the wait would be worth it - and much to my expectation, it was :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

B0MOL20SBXYCGX9Q-e7kRw.text: I don't understand what all the hype is about and it's certainly not worth standing in an hour queue for. The vegetarian traditional English breakfast was alright at best. The restaurant itself was crowded and smelled like smoke. The tomato on the plate tasted off and the beans tasted like straight sugar. The veggie sausage was almost inedible. The service was good and it has a quirky vibe but I would recommend skipping it.

ruD42XOD2cK1gVldDWwOeg.text: very nice brunch. you feel absolutely full after. Good to keep you for a long day touring in London.Tasty pancakes and good value for money!

knwLs-w-a4vhSiYI7hK0dw.text: Sadly we had to wait in line for about 40 minutes on a Wednesday morning, but when we left we saw that the line was even longer, so seems like we got lucky with that sort of wait!We got the Full Monty (full English breakfast) and the smoked salmon scrambled eggs on toasted rye bread. I really enjoyed the black pudding that came with the full monty - the flavor was pretty normal as far as black pudding goes, and was a much meatier flavor. Obviously a fantastic value as well! My poached eggs were beautifully runny too. The smoked salmon scrambled eggs was delicious, but needed salt - I would definitely recommend the full monty.

ZKCqcCCBzsGzk2tbAaGxnQ.text: I honestly did enjoy my visit, but I struggle to see what the hype is all about and I certainly don't think it's worth spending hours queuing for. The pancakes are relatively expensive but the portions are sizeable. I think that it's definitely worth visiting once but probably no more than that.

Znl0iqIVrtyKdZcHLYd4tQ.text: You hear all these things about the breakfast club and one day you decide to try it. It was okay. And that might even be a bit of a stretch. I loved the atmosphere - couldn't ask for more on that point - and the service was brilliant. We had to queue for about 45 minutes though, and they food was meh. Wasn't bad, but I have definitely had better. I'd go here again if it wasn't for the long wait, but in the end it was just not worth it.

TJkAvcDnZNAUPxIp1oMtYA.text: All American breakfast. Place is okay but not the prettiest. Prepare to over-eat. Waiters were nice. Have their eggs or pancakes.

Fft4RxIl7b52lgEBWaxhig.text: Best legit hangover brunch in Soho.Per a prior reviewer "But It's crowded, dirty and falling apart."~precisely. If you don't feel a little dirty the next morning people, you weren't havin' enough fun.

LhtBsL_1WOIp0UqYIeQLbg.text: Brilliant!Couldn't find a decent brekky or coffee spot in London and had this place recommended.We did well, only a 5 minute wait, although others were waiting a lot longer.Good coffee and great English brekky, keep up the good work guys

xu1kAT8YTaibAon3kJqx-w.text: Fantastic place! We stayed in London over the weekend and fancied a big English on the Saturday morning! After searching on Qype we found this place and the reviews were good so we thought let's give it a try. We arrived around 10.30 and the place was packed! We were told very nicely that we would have to wait outside, there was a queue of around six in front if us. How had we missed them walking in! Waiting outside was nice as it was a crisp sunny morning and it wasn't long before we were given a very tight table. We ordered the full Monty and the half Monty and the portions were huge, only thing missing was a sausage and this was soon rectified. The place had an energetic buzz, and the staff were very friendly. When we left about an hour and a half later the queue was around 20! Great place, highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

XiMs0B0b60-A2_inpDrq2g.text: I ordered the pancakes and bacon, hopeful this would be one of the better meals since arriving in London. The glowing reviews and the fast forming queue outside seemed to reinforce this hope.My meal arrived, four pancakes with bacon piled on top. I removed the bacon, noticing that on the same piece there could be areas of cooked-to-perfection and almost-raw, as if, perhaps, they were cooked lying on top of one another and all of a piece didn't have contact with the grill. Ah well, on to the pancakes, the one on top was overdone, the one below it more so, the third...seemed just about right, dark golden brown. I shrugged and dug in, cutting a piece and dabbing it in the pool of syrup on the plate. There were two issues I had with this pancake: 1) it was neither light nor fluffy, more like pound cake, 2) As I was chewing through this heavy monstrosity I caught a glimpse of the last pancake below it and felt bad. The last one was so badly burned I felt I should have rightly saved the one I was eating as a donor for skin grafts for it.The waiter breezed by with a smile and dropped off more syrup. Yeah, that's not the problem here.

fDM5S9QPmWG3kXFXslXjSA.text: The crowds here on Sundays are mad see pic. So beware the q in the photo is about 3 times the seating capacity.We didn't stay but the area is good for alternatives.

tE3hJgn_3Neyybw3Rj1SHg.text: Geez Louise, it sure is disappointing when a place does not live up to ALL the hype your friends build up around it. Such was the case for me with The Breakfast Club. I had heard of several friends meeting regularly at this  venue despite its notorious wait times so I jumped at the opportunity when I could make it to this famed establishment. At the outset, the cramped quarters and the consequent wait in the bracing cold did not set things up well, but I counted on the food being divine, to make up for that. Now, I'd say the food is probably 3 stars - A-OK. Portion sizes are generous, nothing is offensive and everything is as expected, and quite reminiscent of American brunch menus. But really, I failed to see what the big deal was, and therefore, I couldn't help but rate it only 2 stars...would have been 3 stars if I didn't go in with such high expectations!

J5OVAfjWsiRafMoK1N3MPg.text: Tried Full Monty(breakfast platter of egg, sausage, bean etc) and fish sandwich , both are equally great. As a visitor of London, I had a great food experience in this place.

MYpBVh6oyEPSybGISmxmaA.text: Delicious! Great service, awesome food, even better music playlist! Had to wait in a little line to get in, but was definitely worth the wait. My husband and I love breakfast and this one did not disappoint. The atmosphere of the place is very chill/hipster with non stop music from the 90's. Couldn't ask for anything better. Also, order the flat white. You won't regret it!

ldtjK6DGCY95GCoxTbbeEA.text: Had to queue for over an hour for a pretty average meal. I think I made a mistake in my ordering as I got the avocado, poached egg and bacon on toast which is something I can make myself to a way better standard! The avocado had been in the fridge (health and safety so I guess not a bad thing...) which just meant it was very cold and actually not very pleasant against the egg and bacon.A positive thing about this place is the staff. I have no idea how they remain so paitent! You don' feel pressured to leave when you finish your meal which is nice, unless you are in the queue looking through the window at someone taking 30 minutes to finish a cup of coffee!

Ie9Y8uE3T116oEbk1YieEw.text: Probably one of the better places to get breakfast in Soho, but I'd suggest going to the Shoreditch branch instead. There's always a line at Soho, and the inside is really cramped. Waiting 30 minutes for brunch and then having to sit on a stool with my back rubbing against someone else's table (and having to get up whenever the table next to me wants to leave, or is seated, or has to use the restroom) isn't very pleasant.The food is good, but not fantastic. They serve English and American breakfasts like you'd find in a greasy-spoon diner, so don't go expecting the healthiest cuisine. The eggs are good but the pancakes were rather bland. French toast was so-so--not as well-seasoned as it should be. On the plus side, prices are reasonable and portion sizes are decent. The smoothies are one of the highlights--try the "Green is Good". Coffee isn't bad either--something a lot of diners do shockingly poorly, so I'd give them a 4/5 for the coffee.Service is very hit-or-miss--more recently, I've found it leaning towards "miss". The ambiance is friendly and casual but not too tacky.Overall I'm a fan of the Breakfast Club, but their Soho location isn't a shining star. Stick to the eggs and smoothies, try to beat the rush, and hope you get a good seat. Otherwise, go to Shoreditch.

ew9LIYHeM5Q4ISEiUFZaxw.text: Long queue on Sunday morning. We waited for around 20 minutes for a table for 4. Very American deco and music. Service was not bad. Plus average food qualify, it's a nice place for brunch at Canary Wharf.

3o9-gjN3Fnhy6_xRg-Y1BQ.text: 'Eat my shorts!'I'd just like to start by saying that I desperately wanted to like this place yet left wanting to tell my waiter to do just that. It's a shame considering The Breakfast Club is one of my favourite Molly Ringwald films just after Pretty in Pink.Let's start with the service; this is where they definitely fell short. Cafes are, in my own personal opinion, a great place for 'table of 1s' to go and not feel completely 'out of sorts'. After a friend had raved about this place, I decided it was a good spot to get a bit of lunch and spend my afternoon out of the office getting work done without the concern that the waiters and waitresses would be breathing down my neck to 'get out'.  Not even close. Upon arriving, the hostess/waitress sat me in corner table that faced...wait for it...a wall. I wondered if I was being punished for being a table of 1 and not having more people with me? Perhaps I should have pulled my significant other out of work or invited the homeless person I saw earlier that morning for a late lunch just to subsidise their pay check? Regardless, I decided not to be a stereotypical New Yorker by demanding another table. After all, it was semi crowded (though towards the end of the lunch rush hour) and I didn't want to make a huge fuss. When the waiter arrived to take my order, it was as if I was asking the world of him. I was worried I might really upset him when I asked, a few seconds after taking my order, for a glass of tap water with my meal. For the duration of my time there I felt as though I was perpetually in the way of the waitstaff. Par sitting up entirely straight in my chair and ensuring my arms did not dare leave the perimeter of my table, I found I was getting knocked into more than most customers in the cafe. Perhaps this was because they sat me at a table that was probably once used for storage? I felt a bit like Milton from Office Space. Leave my stapler alone Lumberg! (Or in this case, let me drink my coffee and read my manuscripts in peace!)Once finished, I could feel the hovering presence of the waiter, expecting me to pay and leave. Seeing as the wall was my beautiful scenery for the meal, I was unable to tell if the main dining area was full. As I felt I had just as much as I could handle for one meal, I paid and exited the cafe. Upon leaving I noticed, much to my dismay, there were three free tables in the main area; all capable of holding more than 3-4 people.
